name.en: Advanced course in statistics and data analytics, Lecture

workload.fi: Työmäärä opetustavoittain: 6*27,5h koostuen luennoista, harjoituksista, ja itsenäisestä työskentelystä.
workload.sv: Työmäärä opetustavoittain: 6*27,5h koostuen luennoista, harjoituksista, ja itsenäisestä työskentelystä.
workload.en: The total workload of the course: 6*27,5 hrs = 160 hrs, comprised of lectures, exercises, and independent study.

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot (tarkistetaan ilmoittautumisen yhteydessä): Kauppakorkeakoulun opiskelijoille: ISM-A1002 Johdatus data-analytiikkaan (tai 30A01100 Taulukkolaskenta ja analytiikka) sekä 30A02000 Tilastotieteen perusteet. Muille opiskelijoille: edellämainitut tai kurssi MS-A0501 (tai tätä kurssia vastaavat tiedot)
prerequisites.sv: Pakolliset esitiedot (tarkistetaan ilmoittautumisen yhteydessä): Kauppakorkeakoulun opiskelijoille: ISM-A1002 Johdatus data-analytiikkaan (tai 30A01100 Taulukkolaskenta ja analytiikka) sekä 30A02000 Tilastotieteen perusteet. Muille opiskelijoille: edellämainitut tai kurssi MS-A0501 (tai tätä kurssia vastaavat tiedot)
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites (will be checked when registering to the course): For students of the School of Business: ISM-A1002 Introduction to data analytics (or 30A01100 Introduction to Business Analytics) and 30A02000 Introduction to Statistics . For students not in the School of Business: the aforementioned courses, or the course MS-A0501 (or equivalent).

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin käytyään opiskelija
  1. Osaa laskea todennäköisyyksiä ja tilastollisia tunnuslukuja jakaumiin perustuen.
  2. Tuntee moniulotteisten jakaumien perusteet sekä ymmärtää ehdollisten ja reunajakaumien käsitteet sekä osaa johtaa nämä.
  3. Ymmärtää hypoteesin testauksen peruskäsitteet ja osaa teoriassa sekä käytännössä toteuttaa testejä suhde- ja järjestysasteikollisille muuttujille. Osaa myös kriittisesti tulkita näiden tuloksia.
  4. Ymmärtää yhden ja useamman selittäjän regressiomallien periaatteet sekä osaa soveltaa näitä.
  5. Osaa ja ymmärtää suurimman uskottavuuden periaatteen ja osaa soveltaa tätä esimerkiksi logistisen regression tapauksessa. Kykenee myös tekemään päätelmiä saaduista tuloksista.
  6. Osaa R-ohjelman perusteet ja soveltaa näitä em. ongelmien tilanteissa.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Kurssin käytyään opiskelija
  1. Osaa laskea todennäköisyyksiä ja tilastollisia tunnuslukuja jakaumiin perustuen.
  2. Tuntee moniulotteisten jakaumien perusteet sekä ymmärtää ehdollisten ja reunajakaumien käsitteet sekä osaa johtaa nämä.
  3. Ymmärtää hypoteesin testauksen peruskäsitteet ja osaa teoriassa sekä käytännössä toteuttaa testejä suhde- ja järjestysasteikollisille muuttujille. Osaa myös kriittisesti tulkita näiden tuloksia.
  4. Ymmärtää yhden ja useamman selittäjän regressiomallien periaatteet sekä osaa soveltaa näitä.
  5. Osaa ja ymmärtää suurimman uskottavuuden periaatteen ja osaa soveltaa tätä esimerkiksi logistisen regression tapauksessa. Kykenee myös tekemään päätelmiä saaduista tuloksista.
  6. Osaa R-ohjelman perusteet ja soveltaa näitä em. ongelmien tilanteissa.
learningOutcomes.en:
Upon completing the course, the student
  1. Knows how to compute probabilities and moments of random variables and statistical data from their respective distributions
  2. Is familiar with the basics of multivariate probability distributions: understands the concepts of conditional and marginal distributions, and their relation to the joint distribution
  3. Understands the basics of hypothesis testing, and knows how to implement such tests for statistical data both in theory and in practice, both in the case of ratio and ordinal data. The student is also able to critically interpret results of such tests.
  4. Understands the basics of linear regression, both in the single-variable and multivariate case, and is able to apply multivariate regression to relevant statistical problems.
  5. Understands the concept of maximum likelihood estimation (MLE) and is able to apply MLE in the case of logistic regression. The student is also able to make inferences based on MLE.
  6. Knows the basics of R programming, and knows how to apply R to solve statistical problems as outlined above.

content.fi: Todennäköisyysjakaumia ja niihin perustuvaa tilastollista päättelyä, eräitä parametrisiä ja ei-parametrisiä testejä, regressioanalyysiä, suurimman uskottavuuden menetelmä, R-ohjelmointia.
content.sv: Todennäköisyysjakaumia ja niihin perustuvaa tilastollista päättelyä, eräitä parametrisiä ja ei-parametrisiä testejä, regressioanalyysiä, suurimman uskottavuuden menetelmä, R-ohjelmointia.
content.en: Probability distributions and statistical inference, some parametric and non-parametric hypothesis tests, regression analysis, the method of maximum likelihood, R programming.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: Tuloslaskenta (22C00400) tai Tilinpäätösraportointi (ABL-C1133).
prerequisites.sv: Suositellut esitiedot: Tuloslaskenta (22C00400) tai Tilinpäätösraportointi (ABL-C1133).
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Financial Accounting (22C00400 or ABL-C1133)

learningOutcomes.fi: Ymmärtää konsernitilinpäätöksen laadintavelvollisuus ja periaatteet sekä sisältö ja tavoitteet. Antaa perusvalmiudet konsernitilinpäätöksen laatimiseen 1) julkisesti listatussa kansainvälisessä ympäristössä toimivassa osakeyhtiössä ja 2) yksityisessä suomalaisessa osakeyhtiössä. Perehdyttää opiskelijat konsernitilinpäätöksen erityiskysymyksiin (esim. muuntoerot, omistusyhteys-, osakkuus-, ja yhteisyritysten yhdistely, vähemmistöosuuksien käsittely ja konsernirakenteen muutokset). Antaa perusymmärrys tietyistä konsernitilinpäätöstä koskevista IFRS-standardeista (sis. IFRS 3, IFRS 10, IFRS 11, IFRS 12, IFRS 5, IFRS 8, IAS 1, IAS 28)
learningOutcomes.sv: Ymmärtää konsernitilinpäätöksen laadintavelvollisuus ja periaatteet sekä sisältö ja tavoitteet. Antaa perusvalmiudet konsernitilinpäätöksen laatimiseen 1) julkisesti listatussa kansainvälisessä ympäristössä toimivassa osakeyhtiössä ja 2) yksityisessä suomalaisessa osakeyhtiössä. Perehdyttää opiskelijat konsernitilinpäätöksen erityiskysymyksiin (esim. muuntoerot, omistusyhteys-, osakkuus-, ja yhteisyritysten yhdistely, vähemmistöosuuksien käsittely ja konsernirakenteen muutokset). Antaa perusymmärrys tietyistä konsernitilinpäätöstä koskevista IFRS-standardeista (sis. IFRS 3, IFRS 10, IFRS 11, IFRS 12, IFRS 5, IFRS 8, IAS 1, IAS 28)
learningOutcomes.en: Understand the obligation and principles for the preparation of consolidated financial statements, as well as their content and objectives. Provide basic skills for preparing consolidated financial statements in 1) a publicly listed international environment in a limited liability company and 2) a private Finnish limited liability company. Familiarize students with specific issues related to consolidated financial statements (e.g., translation differences, treatment of subsidiaries, associates, and joint ventures, handling of minority interests, and changes in group structure). Provide a basic understanding of certain IFRS standards related to consolidated financial statements (including IFRS 3, IFRS 10, IFRS 11, IFRS 12, IFRS 5, IFRS 8, IAS 1, IAS 28).

content.fi: Konsernin käsite, konsernitilinpäätöstä koskevat säädökset, konsernitilinpäätöksen laajuus ja tavoitteet, konsernin sisäisen omistuksen eliminointi, sisäisten katteiden eliminointi, vähemmistön erottaminen, osakkuus- ja yhteisyritysten yhdistely, konsernirakenteen muutokset, kurssi- ja muuntoerot, tietyt IFRS-standardit.
content.sv: Konsernin käsite, konsernitilinpäätöstä koskevat säädökset, konsernitilinpäätöksen laajuus ja tavoitteet, konsernin sisäisen omistuksen eliminointi, sisäisten katteiden eliminointi, vähemmistön erottaminen, osakkuus- ja yhteisyritysten yhdistely, konsernirakenteen muutokset, kurssi- ja muuntoerot, tietyt IFRS-standardit.
content.en: Concept of a group, regulations concerning consolidated financial statements, scope and objectives of consolidated financial statements, elimination of intra-group ownership, elimination of internal profits, separation of minorities, consolidation of associates and joint ventures, changes in group structure, exchange and translation differences, certain IFRS standards.

assesmentMethods.fi: 1. Luennot 22 h, Juha-Matti Heino, Lotta Lampinen ja Mira Mulari  2. Harjoitukset, 8 h, Juha-Matti Heino, Lotta Lampinen ja Mira Mulari  3. Tentti (80 %/100%), palautettavilla ja pisteytettävillä ennakkotehtävillä voi valinnanvaraisesti korvata yhden kokonaisen tenttikysymyksen. Tentti perustuu luentoihin, harjoituksiin ja ohessa mainittuun kirjallisuuteen sekä erikseen jaettuun/ilmoitettavaan materiaaliin.

assesmentMethods.en:
1. Lectures 22 h
2. Exercises 8 h
3. Exam (80 %/100%), one entire exam question can be replaced with the submitted and scored pre-assignments. The exam is based on lectures, exercises, the literature mentioned, and separately distributed or notified material.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Opintojakson suoritettuaan opiskelija
  • Ymmärtää individuaalisen ja kollektiivisen työoikeuden systematiikan, yleiset opit ja keskeiset periaatteet
  • Hahmottaa työsuhteeseen sekä työmarkkinajärjestelmään liittyvän normijärjestelmän ja keskeisen lainsäädännön
  • Tunnistaa henkilöstön johtamiseen liittyviä, työoikeudellisesti merkityksellisiä kysymyksiä ja osaa analysoida niitä työoikeuden asiantuntemustaan soveltaen
learningOutcomes.sv:
Opintojakson suoritettuaan opiskelija
  • Ymmärtää individuaalisen ja kollektiivisen työoikeuden systematiikan, yleiset opit ja keskeiset periaatteet
  • Hahmottaa työsuhteeseen sekä työmarkkinajärjestelmään liittyvän normijärjestelmän ja keskeisen lainsäädännön
  • Tunnistaa henkilöstön johtamiseen liittyviä, työoikeudellisesti merkityksellisiä kysymyksiä ja osaa analysoida niitä työoikeuden asiantuntemustaan soveltaen
learningOutcomes.en:
On completing the course, the student will: 

•            Understand the key principles, general doctrines and systematics of individual and collective employment law

•            Understand the normative system and key legislation related to employment relationships and the employment market

•            Identify staff management issues of importance with respect to employment law and be are able to analyse them by applying the student’s acquired expertise in employment law.

content.fi: Kurssi antaa kaikille ja erityisesti esimiestehtäviin ja henkilöstöhallinnon alalle aikoville tarpeelliset tiedot individuaalisen ja kollektiivisen työoikeuden keskeisestä sisällöstä.
content.sv: Kurssi antaa kaikille ja erityisesti esimiestehtäviin ja henkilöstöhallinnon alalle aikoville tarpeelliset tiedot individuaalisen ja kollektiivisen työoikeuden keskeisestä sisällöstä.
content.en: The course provides everyone, especially people aiming for HR managerial positions, with essential information on the key content of individual and collective employment aw.

learningOutcomes.fi: Participants will learn to distinguish between business ethics, the business of ethics, and the ethics of business; to assume a critical attitude towards promises of moral improvement in businesses and economies; and to see business activities and economic decisions in their wider social and political contexts.
learningOutcomes.sv: Participants will learn to distinguish between business ethics, the business of ethics, and the ethics of business; to assume a critical attitude towards promises of moral improvement in businesses and economies; and to see business activities and economic decisions in their wider social and political contexts.
learningOutcomes.en: Participants will learn to distinguish between business ethics, the business of ethics, and the ethics of business; to assume a critical attitude towards promises of moral improvement in businesses and economies; and to see business activities and economic decisions in their wider social and political contexts.

literature.en: Readings, including the two books for the literature exams, are provided by the lecturers. A recommended background book is: Bowie, N. (2002) Blackwell Guide to Business Ethics. ISBN 0-631-22123-9
literature.fi: Readings, including the two books for the literature exams, are provided by the lecturers. A recommended background book is: Bowie, N. (2002) Blackwell Guide to Business Ethics. ISBN 0-631-22123-9

content.fi: The topics covered during the course include the business, ethical, political, and critical approaches to corporate social responsibility; political and moral philosophy, justice, and business; neoliberalism, sustainable growth, environmental ethics, and the relationship between law and morality; corporate scandals and their impacts; and diversity and equality in business.
content.sv: The topics covered during the course include the business, ethical, political, and critical approaches to corporate social responsibility; political and moral philosophy, justice, and business; neoliberalism, sustainable growth, environmental ethics, and the relationship between law and morality; corporate scandals and their impacts; and diversity and equality in business.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin tarkoituksena on perehtyä syvällisesti eurooppalaisen arvonlisäverojärjestelmän ydinkysymyksiin ja haasteisiin. Jokaisella kurssikerralla (6 kpl) analysoidaan yhtä aihealuetta. Kurssin tarkoituksena on antaa opiskelijalle valmiudet syvälliseen arvonlisäverotusta koskevien kysymysten analysointiin ja ratkaisemiseen. Lähtökohtana kurssilla on EU:n arvonlisäverodirektiivi 2006/112/EU sekä Euroopan unionin tuomioistuimen oikeuskäytäntö.Tämä kurssi tukee opiskelijoiden yrittäjämäistä ajattelutapaa.
 
Opiskelija valmistautuu jokaiseen tapaamiskertaan etukäteismateriaalin pohjalta sekä valmistelee esittelemään aiheen. Osa materiaalista on englanniksi mutta kurssi toteutetaan suomen kielellä. Esittelyn jälkeen käymme keskustelua aiheen tiimoilta. Kaikkien kurssilaisten aktiivista osallistumista edellytetään jokaisella tapaamiskerralla. Emme etsi ”oikeita vastauksia”, vaan kehitämme analyyttistä ajattelua arvonlisäverojärjestelmän perusteista käsin. Kurssi vaatii heittäytymistä mukaan luovaan ajatteluun ja vie opiskelijan arvonlisävero-osaamisen aivan uudelle tasolle. Kurssimateriaalina käytetään paljon käytännön esimerkkejä reaalimaailmasta sekä EU-tuomioistuimen oikeuskäytäntöä. Jotta kurssi toisi opiskelijalle mahdollisimman paljon lisäarvoa, arvonlisäveron peruskurssit tulee olla suoritettuna.

content.fi:
1. Yleiset periaatteet: Mitkä ovat arvonlisäverojärjestelmän peruspilarit? Miten EU-oikeus vaikuttaa arvonlisäverotukseen eri tilanteissa? Mikä on neutralitettiperiaate ja sen suhde yhdenvertaisuusperiaatteeseen? Muut arvonlisäverotuksen merkittävät periaatteet. Ensimmäisen tapaamiskerran aihe on teoreettisempi ja sen tarkoituksena on vahvistaa opiskelijan kykyä ajatella käytännön verokysymyksiä analyyttisesti teoriaa unohtamatta.
  2. Kansainvälinen tavara- ja palvelukauppa: Verotuspaikkasäännösten kertauksen jälkeen pohdimme muun muassa seuraavia asioita: Mitä merkitystä on yrityksen sijoittautumisella toiseen valtioon? Onko eroa sillä, onko sijoitusmuoto sivuliike vai tytäryhtiö? Mitä merkitystä konsernilla voi olla verotuksen näkökulmasta? Mikä on sopimusten merkitys? Miten tullit vaikuttavat arvonlisäverotukseen vai vaikuttavatko? Erilaisten transaktioketujen merkitys eri toimijoille. Perehdymme myös teknologian tuomiin mahdollisuuksiin arvonlisäverojärjestelmän kehittämisessä. Olemmeko jo löytäneet arvonlisäveron lopullisen järjestelmän EU:ssa?
  3. Vapautukset arvonlisäverosta: Arvonlisäverodirektiivin 132-135 artikloissa on säädetty tiettyjen tavaroiden ja palveluiden verottomuudesta. Mitä vapautus merkitsee arvonlisäverojärjestelmän toiminnalle? Millaisia ongelmia se tuo tullessaan? Toteuttaako vapautus tehtäväänsä? Käymme esimerkinomaisesti oikeustapausten avulla läpi erilaisia vapautuksia kuten non-profit-toimijat, sosiaali- ja terveyspalvelut, koulutuspalvelut sekä eräiden tavaroiden vapautukset. Millaisia ongelmia vapautukset tuovat rajatylittäviin tilanteisiin?
  4. Rahoitusmarkkinat: Rahoituspalvelut on vapautettu arvonlisäverosta. Verottomat rahoituspalvelut on myös määritelty arvonlisäverodirektiivissä mutta ala haastaa jatkuvasti EU-tuomioistuinta uusilla tapauksilla. Perehdymme tiettyihin rahoitusalan erityiskysymyksiin kuten ulkoistamisiin, osake- ja johdannaiskauppaan, sijoitusrahastoihin ja maksunvälitykseen. Erilaiset rahoituspalveluiden välitysmuodot näyttelevät keskustelussamme merkittävää osaa. Onko merkitystä sillä, onko kysymyksessä omaisuudenhoito, osakkeiden alivälitys tai sijoitusrahaston hallinnoinnin ulkoistaminen?
  1. Kiinteistöjen verotus: Kurssilla perehdytään kiinteistöinvestointien, rakentamisen ja kiinteistötransaktioiden arvonlisäverotukseen oikeuskäytännön sekä reaalimaailman esimerkkien avulla. Mitä on omaan lukuun rakentaminen? Mistä vero suoritetaan ja mikä on vähennyskelpoista? Mitä tulee huomioida kiinteistöjä myytäessä? Mitä ovat kiinteistöinvestoinnit? Tässä eräitä keskustelun aiheita.
  2. Vähennysoikeudet: Ehkä arvonlisäverotuksen vaikein asia vaikkei pitäisi. Keskitymme pohtimaan erityisesti verottoman ja arvonlisäverojärjestelmän ulkopuolisen toiminnan vaikutusta verovelvollisen vähennysoikeuteen. Mitkä kustannukset kuuluvat verolliseen liiketoimintaan ja mitkä eivät? Pohdimme onko nykyinen oikeuskäytäntö perusteltavissa.

Mikä on neutralitettiperiaate ja sen suhde yhdenvertaisuusperiaatteeseen? Muut arvonlisäverotuksen merkittävät periaatteet. Ensimmäisen tapaamiskerran aihe on teoreettisempi ja sen tarkoituksena on vahvistaa opiskelijan kykyä ajatella käytännön verokysymyksiä analyyttisesti teoriaa unohtamatta.
  2. Kansainvälinen tavara- ja palvelukauppa: Verotuspaikkasäännösten kertauksen jälkeen pohdimme muun muassa seuraavia asioita: Mitä merkitystä on yrityksen sijoittautumisella toiseen valtioon? Onko eroa sillä, onko sijoitusmuoto sivuliike vai tytäryhtiö? Mitä merkitystä konsernilla voi olla verotuksen näkökulmasta? Mikä on sopimusten merkitys? Miten tullit vaikuttavat arvonlisäverotukseen vai vaikuttavatko? Erilaisten transaktioketujen merkitys eri toimijoille. Perehdymme myös teknologian tuomiin mahdollisuuksiin arvonlisäverojärjestelmän kehittämisessä. Olemmeko jo löytäneet arvonlisäveron lopullisen järjestelmän EU:ssa?
  3. Vapautukset arvonlisäverosta: Arvonlisäverodirektiivin 132-135 artikloissa on säädetty tiettyjen tavaroiden ja palveluiden verottomuudesta. Mitä vapautus merkitsee arvonlisäverojärjestelmän toiminnalle? Millaisia ongelmia se tuo tullessaan? Toteuttaako vapautus tehtäväänsä? Käymme esimerkinomaisesti oikeustapausten avulla läpi erilaisia vapautuksia kuten non-profit-toimijat, sosiaali- ja terveyspalvelut, koulutuspalvelut sekä eräiden tavaroiden vapautukset. Millaisia ongelmia vapautukset tuovat rajatylittäviin tilanteisiin?
  4. Rahoitusmarkkinat: Rahoituspalvelut on vapautettu arvonlisäverosta. Verottomat rahoituspalvelut on myös määritelty arvonlisäverodirektiivissä mutta ala haastaa jatkuvasti EU-tuomioistuinta uusilla tapauksilla. Perehdymme tiettyihin rahoitusalan erityiskysymyksiin kuten ulkoistamisiin, osake- ja johdannaiskauppaan, sijoitusrahastoihin ja maksunvälitykseen. Erilaiset rahoituspalveluiden välitysmuodot näyttelevät keskustelussamme merkittävää osaa. Onko merkitystä sillä, onko kysymyksessä omaisuudenhoito, osakkeiden alivälitys tai sijoitusrahaston hallinnoinnin ulkoistaminen?
  1. Kiinteistöjen verotus: Kurssilla perehdytään kiinteistöinvestointien, rakentamisen ja kiinteistötransaktioiden arvonlisäverotukseen oikeuskäytännön sekä reaalimaailman esimerkkien avulla. Mitä on omaan lukuun rakentaminen? Mistä vero suoritetaan ja mikä on vähennyskelpoista? Mitä tulee huomioida kiinteistöjä myytäessä? Mitä ovat kiinteistöinvestoinnit? Tässä eräitä keskustelun aiheita.
  2. Vähennysoikeudet: Ehkä arvonlisäverotuksen vaikein asia vaikkei pitäisi. Keskitymme pohtimaan erityisesti verottoman ja arvonlisäverojärjestelmän ulkopuolisen toiminnan vaikutusta verovelvollisen vähennysoikeuteen. Mitkä kustannukset kuuluvat verolliseen liiketoimintaan ja mitkä eivät? Pohdimme onko nykyinen oikeuskäytäntö perusteltavissa.
content.en:
1. Yleiset periaatteet: Mitkä ovat arvonlisäverojärjestelmän peruspilarit? Miten EU-oikeus vaikuttaa arvonlisäverotukseen eri tilanteissa? Mikä on neutralitettiperiaate ja sen suhde yhdenvertaisuusperiaatteeseen? Muut arvonlisäverotuksen merkittävät periaatteet. Ensimmäisen tapaamiskerran aihe on teoreettisempi ja sen tarkoituksena on vahvistaa opiskelijan kykyä ajatella käytännön verokysymyksiä analyyttisesti teoriaa unohtamatta.

  3. Vapautukset arvonlisäverosta: Arvonlisäverodirektiivin 132-135 artikloissa on säädetty tiettyjen tavaroiden ja palveluiden verottomuudesta. Mitä vapautus merkitsee arvonlisäverojärjestelmän toiminnalle? Millaisia ongelmia se tuo tullessaan? Toteuttaako vapautus tehtäväänsä? Käymme esimerkinomaisesti oikeustapausten avulla läpi erilaisia vapautuksia kuten non-profit-toimijat, sosiaali- ja terveyspalvelut, koulutuspalvelut sekä eräiden tavaroiden vapautukset. Millaisia ongelmia vapautukset tuovat rajatylittäviin tilanteisiin?
  4. Rahoitusmarkkinat: Rahoituspalvelut on vapautettu arvonlisäverosta. Verottomat rahoituspalvelut on myös määritelty arvonlisäverodirektiivissä mutta ala haastaa jatkuvasti EU-tuomioistuinta uusilla tapauksilla. Perehdymme tiettyihin rahoitusalan erityiskysymyksiin kuten ulkoistamisiin, osake- ja johdannaiskauppaan, sijoitusrahastoihin ja maksunvälitykseen. Erilaiset rahoituspalveluiden välitysmuodot näyttelevät keskustelussamme merkittävää osaa.   1. Kiinteistöjen verotus: Kurssilla perehdytään kiinteistöinvestointien, rakentamisen ja kiinteistötransaktioiden arvonlisäverotukseen oikeuskäytännön sekä reaalimaailman esimerkkien avulla. Mitä on omaan lukuun rakentaminen? Mistä vero suoritetaan ja mikä on vähennyskelpoista? Mitä tulee huomioida kiinteistöjä myytäessä? Mitä ovat kiinteistöinvestoinnit? Tässä eräitä keskustelun aiheita.
  2. Vähennysoikeudet: Ehkä arvonlisäverotuksen vaikein asia vaikkei pitäisi. Keskitymme pohtimaan erityisesti verottoman ja arvonlisäverojärjestelmän ulkopuolisen toiminnan vaikutusta verovelvollisen vähennysoikeuteen. workload.fi: 160 hours (6 cr). The workload per activity type will be announced in the course syllabus.

prerequisites.fi: Principles of economics or equivalent.
prerequisites.sv: Principles of economics or equivalent.
prerequisites.en: Principles of economics or equivalent.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course, the student understands the main economic forces that lead to the existence of cities. The student is familiar with the theories related to the emergence of cities and their role on agglomeration, productivity, urban amenities, and congestion. The student is familiar with key/main models of urban economics and understands the determinants of urban land values, and how land values vary within and between cities. The student is familiar with methodologies to evaluate urban characteristics, and the challenges of these methodologies. The student is familiar with the role and challenges related to housing and urban policies.
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course, the student understands the main economic forces that lead to the existence of cities. The student is familiar with the theories related to the emergence of cities and their role on agglomeration, productivity, urban amenities, and congestion. The student is familiar with key/main models of urban economics and understands the determinants of urban land values, and how land values vary within and between cities. The student is familiar with methodologies to evaluate urban characteristics, and the challenges of these methodologies. The student is familiar with the role and challenges related to housing and urban policies.

The student is familiar with the theories related to the emergence of cities and their role on agglomeration, productivity, urban amenities, and congestion. The student is familiar with key/main models of urban economics and understands the determinants of urban land values, and how land values vary within and between cities. The student is familiar with methodologies to evaluate urban characteristics, and the challenges of these methodologies. The student is familiar with the role and challenges related to housing and urban policies.

prerequisites.fi: Principles of Economics (31A00110, ECON-A2100, or equivalent) and Introduction to Statistics (30A02000/MS-A0503) or equivalent.

learningOutcomes.fi: Students are acquainted with the principles of empirical methods in economics, regression analysis in particular. They know how to utilize those methods in analyzing data. They know how to use the econometrics software package stata.
learningOutcomes.sv: Students are acquainted with the principles of empirical methods in economics, regression analysis in particular. They know how to utilize those methods in analyzing data. They know how to use the econometrics software package stata.
learningOutcomes.en: Students are acquainted with the principles of empirical methods in economics, regression analysis in particular. They know how to utilize those methods in analyzing data. They know how to use the econometrics software package stata.

content.fi: Short recap of probability and statistics; basics of cross-section linear regression; hypothesis testing; evaluation of the reliability of regression results; instrumental variable regression.

content.en: Short recap of probability and statistics; basics of cross-section linear regression; hypothesis testing; evaluation of the reliability of regression results; instrumental variable regression.

Tiedot ja ymmärrys
- neuvottelujen roolin kriittinen pohdinta ja arviointi
- eri neuvottelumenetelmien ja työkalujen kuvailu ja arviointi
- käytännön asioiden huomioon ottaminen neuvottelumalleissa ja systeemeissä
- organisaatiotekijöiden huomioon ottaminen neuvotteluissa Taidot
- yksinkertaisten neuvottelujen suunnittelu ja analyysi
- neuvottelumalleissa tarvittavan relevantin informaation elisitointi
- monitavoitteellisten neuvottelujen analyysi
- monen osapuolen neuvottelumallien suunnittelu ja käyttö

learningOutcomes.fi: The course is intended to provide an overall understanding of logistics and distribution networks. Students will understand how logistics activities are to be organized, and how they play a key role for global businesses in a turbulent and constantly chainging marketplace. The course will also provide insights into the diverse operational and strategic content of logistics/distribution, which is essential for the effective management of global supply chains that have become more complex with a multitude of challenges.
learningOutcomes.sv: The course is intended to provide an overall understanding of logistics and distribution networks. Students will understand how logistics activities are to be organized, and how they play a key role for global businesses in a turbulent and constantly chainging marketplace. The course will also provide insights into the diverse operational and strategic content of logistics/distribution, which is essential for the effective management of global supply chains that have become more complex with a multitude of challenges.
learningOutcomes.en: The course is intended to provide an overall understanding of logistics and distribution networks. Students will understand how logistics activities are to be organized, and how they play a key role for global businesses in a turbulent and constantly chainging marketplace. The course will also provide insights into the diverse operational and strategic content of logistics/distribution, which is essential for the effective management of global supply chains that have become more complex with a multitude of challenges.

content.fi: The course topics include an overview of global logistics, logistics infrastructure, logistics and the spatial networks, modes of transportation, transportation planning and execution, logistics outsourcing, transportation network design and optimization, distribution networks and retailing, and logistics risk management.
content.sv: The course topics include an overview of global logistics, logistics infrastructure, logistics and the spatial networks, modes of transportation, transportation planning and execution, logistics outsourcing, transportation network design and optimization, distribution networks and retailing, and logistics risk management.
content.en: The course topics include an overview of global logistics, logistics infrastructure, logistics and the spatial networks, modes of transportation, transportation planning and execution, logistics outsourcing, transportation network design and optimization, distribution networks and retailing, and logistics risk management.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Prerequisites: students should have a foundational knowledge of operations management and supply chains Strongly recommended to already have taken at least 1 or several of the following: - Sales and Operations Planning - Sustainable Supply Chains - Business Decisions 2 / Business Analytics 2

prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Prerequisites: students should have a foundational knowledge of operations management and supply chains Strongly recommended to already have taken at least 1 or several of the following: - Sales and Operations Planning - Sustainable Supply Chains - Business Decisions 2 / Business Analytics 2

learningOutcomes.fi: This course aims to provide students with a solid understanding of the various strategies, structures, processes, and performance dimensions related to supply chain management (SCM). It will cover key concepts, models, and mechanisms developed for coordinating demand and supply networks. The objective of the course is to develop skills in analyzing complex supply chain systems and applying this knowledge in the course project. Each student is expected to form a personal view of the theory of SCM; critically assess qualitative & quantitative supply chain models; exercise his/her knowledge in in an innovative manner through the development of a solution, addressing a critical issue(s) in supply chain management.
learningOutcomes.sv: This course aims to provide students with a solid understanding of the various strategies, structures, processes, and performance dimensions related to supply chain management (SCM). It will cover key concepts, models, and mechanisms developed for coordinating demand and supply networks. The objective of the course is to develop skills in analyzing complex supply chain systems and applying this knowledge in the course project. Each student is expected to form a personal view of the theory of SCM; critically assess qualitative & quantitative supply chain models; exercise his/her knowledge in in an innovative manner through the development of a solution, addressing a critical issue(s) in supply chain management.
learningOutcomes.en: This course aims to provide students with a solid understanding of the various strategies, structures, processes, and performance dimensions related to supply chain management (SCM). It will cover key concepts, models, and mechanisms developed for coordinating demand and supply networks. The objective of the course is to develop skills in analyzing complex supply chain systems and applying this knowledge in the course project. Each student is expected to form a personal view of the theory of SCM; critically assess qualitative & quantitative supply chain models; exercise his/her knowledge in in an innovative manner through the development of a solution, addressing a critical issue(s) in supply chain management.

content.fi:
Main topics covered in this course are:
  • Supply Chain Strategies, Structure, Processes
  • Uncertainity and Risk in Supply Chains
  • Supply Chain Performance 
  • Supply Chain Contracts & Incentives
  • Collaborative Models & Information Sharing in Supply Chains
  • Future Directions in SCM
  There will also be a course project where the students will form teams and be able to apply their theoretical and practical knowledge towards a specific problem / issue within the supply chain domain (e.g.)demand-supply matching, flow coordination, sharing of supply chain information, collaborative planning, transportation lead time reduction, supply chain risk mitigation, logistics synchronization, supply chain contracting, etc..   Students are encouraged to exercise creative and innovative thinking in order to: propose a solution addressing a specific supply chain problem; identify size of the market; analyze the costs and benefits; and develop a business and revenue model for the proposed solution.

assesmentMethods.fi:
Students will be assessed based on the following criteria and assignements:
  • Final Exam
  • Article Reviews
  • Course Project
  • Class Participation*
* Course attendance policy is based on site learning - If a student misses 3 lectures, then he / she will not receive credit for the course unless there is a valid reason for the absence.

learningOutcomes.fi: Business success depends on a company's ability to produce  products and services to match customers need. The aim of this course is to familiarize students with concepts and methods in quality and performance management. Further, students will understand the role of quality in  related to all processes and products/services of a company, and to understand that better quality products/services and processes enhance the company's performance and thus improve the company's profitability.
learningOutcomes.sv: Business success depends on a company's ability to produce  products and services to match customers need. The aim of this course is to familiarize students with concepts and methods in quality and performance management. Further, students will understand the role of quality in  related to all processes and products/services of a company, and to understand that better quality products/services and processes enhance the company's performance and thus improve the company's profitability.
learningOutcomes.en: Business success depends on a company's ability to produce  products and services to match customers need. The aim of this course is to familiarize students with concepts and methods in quality and performance management. Further, students will understand the role of quality in  related to all processes and products/services of a company, and to understand that better quality products/services and processes enhance the company's performance and thus improve the company's profitability.

content.fi: The main concepts and topics of the course include definitions of quality and performance management, total quality management, lean, six sigma, statistical process control, and different quality certificates. Those who pass the course will also receive Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt certification.

The course consists of lectures, independent work (e.g. self-study, writing essays) and teamwork (e.g. hands-on exercises, case studies, group tasks).
This is a hybrid course meaning that students can complete the course either in-class or remotely. Attendance in the contact sessions is mandatory for those students who choose to complete the course in person but it is not compulsory for those students who choose to complete the course remotely.

learningOutcomes.fi: Tieto- ja viestintäteknologiat (ICT) sekä data ovat muuttaneet yritysten toimintaa ja menestymisen edellytyksiä nykypäivän globaalissa taloudessa. Organisaatiot voivat nyt käyttää ICT:tä ja dataa transformoidakseen itsensä ja saavuttaakseen selkeän kilpailuedun, myös kestävyystavoitteita samalla edistäen. Toisaalta niitä organisaatioita, jotka eivät hallitse näitä resursseja, ei välttämättä edes ole lähitulevaisuudessa. Tämä kurssi korostaa kuinka uudet teknologiat ja data muuttavat nykyistä liiketoimintaympäristöä ja miten se vaikuttaa tämän päivän opiskelijoihin. Kurssilla käsitellään johdon tietojärjestelmien (MIS) tärkeimpiä periaatteita, jotta johtajia voidaan valmistaa ymmärtämään tieto- ja viestintäteknologioiden ja datan strategista roolia digitaalisessa taloudessa. Tämän kurssin tavoitteena on antaa opiskelijoille mitä he tarvitsevat menestyäkseen nykyisessä digitaalisessa taloudessa.
learningOutcomes.sv: Tieto- ja viestintäteknologiat (ICT) sekä data ovat muuttaneet yritysten toimintaa ja menestymisen edellytyksiä nykypäivän globaalissa taloudessa. Organisaatiot voivat nyt käyttää ICT:tä ja dataa transformoidakseen itsensä ja saavuttaakseen selkeän kilpailuedun, myös kestävyystavoitteita samalla edistäen. Toisaalta niitä organisaatioita, jotka eivät hallitse näitä resursseja, ei välttämättä edes ole lähitulevaisuudessa. Tämä kurssi korostaa kuinka uudet teknologiat ja data muuttavat nykyistä liiketoimintaympäristöä ja miten se vaikuttaa tämän päivän opiskelijoihin. Kurssilla käsitellään johdon tietojärjestelmien (MIS) tärkeimpiä periaatteita, jotta johtajia voidaan valmistaa ymmärtämään tieto- ja viestintäteknologioiden ja datan strategista roolia digitaalisessa taloudessa. Tämän kurssin tavoitteena on antaa opiskelijoille mitä he tarvitsevat menestyäkseen nykyisessä digitaalisessa taloudessa.
learningOutcomes.en: Information and communication technologies and data have changed how businesses operate and succeed in today's global economy. Organizations can now use ICT and data to transform themselves and achieve a tremendous competitive advantage, promoting concurrently also sustainability transformation. On the other hand, those organizations that are not mastering these assets might not exist in the near future. This course highlights how new technologies and data are changing the current business environment and what effect it has on today's students. The course addresses the major principles of Management Information Systems (MIS) in order to prepare managers to understand the strategic role of information and communication technologies and data in the digital economy. This course aims to give students what they need to succeed in the current digital economy.

content.fi: 1. Tietojärjestelmät ja erilaisten johtajien rooli 2: Tietojärjestelmät määriteltynä 3: Organisaation tietojärjestelmät ja niiden vaikutukset 4: Digitaalinen murros ja kilpailuympäristö 5: Digitaalinen transformaatio, innovaatiot ja yrittäjyys 6: Strategisten tietojärjestelmien suunnittelu 7: Arvonluonti ja strategiset tietojärjestelmät 8: Arvonluonti digitalisaation avulla 9: Arvon varmistaminen digitalisaation avulla10: Tietojärjestelmien hallinta 11: Tietojärjestelmien kehittäminen digitaaliaikana 12: Tietojärjestelmätrendit (mm. digivihreä siirtymä)13: Kyberturvallisuus, yksityisyys ja etiikka

content.en: 1. Information Systems and the Role of General and Functional Managers2: Information Systems Defined3: Organizational Information Systems and Their Impact4: Digital Disruption and the Competitive Environment5: Digital Transformation, Innovation, and Entrepreneurship6: Strategic Information Systems Planning7: Value Creation and Strategic Information Systems8: Digital Value Creation9: Digital Value Capture10: Managing Information Systems11: Creating Information Systems in the Digital Age12: Information Systems Trends (e.g. green-digital transition)13: Cybersecurity, Privacy, and Ethics

learningOutcomes.fi: This course introduces the information system development process to the students. During course the students will learn about the main development frameworks (E.g. waterfall, agile) and different ways of defining the system requirements as well as modeling the data flows and their organization in an information system. After the course, the students know the basics of the main tasks in the information systems development processes. They will also understand the multidisciplinary nature of this work and how the different tasks may be orchestrated to work together. Students will also learn to apply the knowledge they have learned to real-world problems.

content.fi: Must know: Software development processes: Waterfall model, iterative development models, Agile methods in software development, Determining system requirements, Data flow model(s), Object oriented analysis (OOA), Entity-relationship model, Relational model, Normalization, System architectures and data structures, and Outsourcing.

prerequisites.fi: Courses 30A01100 Taulukkolaskenta ja analytiikka (Spreadsheet computation and analytics), 30A02000 Tilastotieteen perusteet (Introduction to statistics), and 30A03000 Talousmatematiikan perusteet (Introduction to business mathematics). Courses 30C00600 Tilastotieteen jatkokurssi (Continuation course in statistics) and 27C01000 Business Analytics 1 are highly recommended. Equivalent studies in mathematics/statistics from another school/university are also acceptable.

Courses 30C00600 Tilastotieteen jatkokurssi (Continuation course in statistics) and 27C01000 Business Analytics 1 are highly recommended. Equivalent studies in mathematics/statistics from another school/university are also acceptable.

learningOutcomes.fi: Management Science deals with the use of analytical models to help make better business decisions. This course focuses on models for supporting decision making under uncertainty, risk and multiple objectives. After the course the student can (i) recognize the types of real-life business problems where use of the models brings added value, (ii) interpret results of these models to derive defensible decision recommendations, and (iii) build and solve these models using a computer to support business decision making.

literature.en: Lecture slides, articles, assignments, computer implementations of mathematical models, and the textbook (An Introduction to Management Science by Anderson et al., 2014, ISBN Code: 978-1-111-82361-0).
literature.fi: Lecture slides, articles, assignments, computer implementations of mathematical models, and the textbook (An Introduction to Management Science by Anderson et al., 2014, ISBN Code: 978-1-111-82361-0).

content.fi: Monte Carlo simulation, decision trees, value of information, expected utility theory, risk attitudes, stochastic dominance, risk measures, multi-attribute utility/value theory, modelling uncertainties and multiple objectives in optimization problems.

learningOutcomes.fi: Decision analytics comprises methods and tools for supporting better decision making. Often, decision analytics models must be structured in collaboration with human decision makers to capture the decision makers' values, preferences, and beliefs, and to create a sense of ownership of the decision recommendations generated by the model. This course focuses on tools and facilitation techniques in such collaborative decision analytics processes. After taking the course, the student can (i) recognize the types of real-life business problems where the use of models adds value, (ii) facilitate processes for structuring such models in collaboration with human decision makers, and (iii) interpret the results of these models to derive defensible decision recommendations.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: This course will build on the basics of operations management, statistics, and optimization. In particular, it is strongly recommended that students have completed the following courses: - ISM-A3002 Tuotannon ja palveluiden johtaminen (Operations and service management), - ISM-C1002 Tilastotieteen ja data-analytiikan jatkokurssi (Advanced course in statistics and data analytics), - ISM-C1004 Business Analytics 1, or obtained equivalent skills from other university-level courses. These skills include the basics of linear algebra, multivariate functions, probability and random variables, regression models, and linear optimization. Experience with a programming language such as R or Python will be useful.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: This course will build on the basics of operations management, statistics, and optimization. In particular, it is strongly recommended that students have completed the following courses: - ISM-A3002 Tuotannon ja palveluiden johtaminen (Operations and service management), - ISM-C1002 Tilastotieteen ja data-analytiikan jatkokurssi (Advanced course in statistics and data analytics), - ISM-C1004 Business Analytics 1, or obtained equivalent skills from other university-level courses. These skills include the basics of linear algebra, multivariate functions, probability and random variables, regression models, and linear optimization. Experience with a programming language such as R or Python will be useful.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: This course will build on the basics of operations management, statistics, and optimization. In particular, it is strongly recommended that students have completed the following courses: - ISM-A3002 Tuotannon ja palveluiden johtaminen (Operations and service management), - ISM-C1002 Tilastotieteen ja data-analytiikan jatkokurssi (Advanced course in statistics and data analytics), - ISM-C1004 Business Analytics 1, or obtained equivalent skills from other university-level courses. These skills include the basics of linear algebra, multivariate functions, probability and random variables, regression models, and linear optimization. Experience with a programming language such as R or Python will be useful.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Understanding the demand for products and services is vital across business operations. This course provides students with tools and techniques for (i) analyzing and forecasting the demand of a product and (ii) managing this demand through pricing and capacity decisions. Collectively, these tools are referred to as revenue management.
After the course, students will be able to identify appropriate demand analysis and forecasting tools for different types of products and services and apply these tools to practical applications, and understand the value and limits of revenue management tools in controlling demand.

After the course, students will be able to identify appropriate demand analysis and forecasting tools for different types of products and services and apply these tools to practical applications, and understand the value and limits of revenue management tools in controlling demand.
learningOutcomes.en:
Understanding the demand for products and services is vital across business operations. This course provides students with tools and techniques for (i) analyzing and forecasting the demand of a product and (ii) managing this demand through pricing and capacity decisions. Collectively, these tools are referred to as revenue management.
After the course, students will be able to identify appropriate demand analysis and forecasting tools for different types of products and services and apply these tools to practical applications, and understand the value and limits of revenue management tools in controlling demand.

content.fi: The course will cover demand analytics and forecasting as well as revenue management and price optimization, including the process of identifying problems where employing analytics is appropriate, translating problems into models, and interpreting the results. The topics covered will include, for example, statistical and optimization models applied to settings in e.g., transportation, hospitality, retail, media, and energy.

The topics covered will include, for example, statistical and optimization models applied to settings in e.g., transportation, hospitality, retail, media, and energy.

learningOutcomes.fi: Antaa perustiedot yrityksen rahoituksen analysoinnista, suunnittelusta ja rahoitusmarkkinoiden toiminnasta sekä yritysjohdon että ulkopuolisen tarkastelijan näkökulmasta.
learningOutcomes.sv: Antaa perustiedot yrityksen rahoituksen analysoinnista, suunnittelusta ja rahoitusmarkkinoiden toiminnasta sekä yritysjohdon että ulkopuolisen tarkastelijan näkökulmasta.
learningOutcomes.en: To provide basic information on the analysis and planning of corporate finance, and the functioning of financial markets from both the perspective of corporate management and an external observer.

content.fi: Rahoitusmarkkinoiden tehtävät ja rakenne, rahoituksen lähteet, arvopapereiden hinnoittelu, investointilaskelmat, tuotto ja riski, markkinoiden tehokkuus ja sijoittaminen, rahoituspäätökset, riskienhallinta ja johdannaiset.
content.sv: Rahoitusmarkkinoiden tehtävät ja rakenne, rahoituksen lähteet, arvopapereiden hinnoittelu, investointilaskelmat, tuotto ja riski, markkinoiden tehokkuus ja sijoittaminen, rahoituspäätökset, riskienhallinta ja johdannaiset.
content.en: The structure and functions of financial markets, sources of finance, pricing of securities, capital budgeting decisions, expected return and risk, market efficiency and investing, financial decisions, risk management, and derivatives.

  4. Tentti (75%), perustuu luentoihin ja luennoilla jaettavaan/erikseen ilmoitettavaan materiaaliin ja ohessa mainittuun kirjallisuuteen.

learningOutcomes.fi: Antaa perustiedot yrityksen rahoituksen analysoinnista, suunnittelusta ja rahoitusmarkkinoiden toiminnasta sekä yritysjohdon että ulkopuolisen tarkastelijan näkökulmasta.
learningOutcomes.sv: Antaa perustiedot yrityksen rahoituksen analysoinnista, suunnittelusta ja rahoitusmarkkinoiden toiminnasta sekä yritysjohdon että ulkopuolisen tarkastelijan näkökulmasta.
learningOutcomes.en: To provide basic information on the analysis and planning of corporate finance, and the functioning of financial markets from both the perspective of corporate management and an external observer.

content.fi: Rahoitusmarkkinoiden tehtävät ja rakenne, rahoituksen lähteet, arvopapereiden hinnoittelu, investointilaskelmat, tuotto ja riski, markkinoiden tehokkuus ja sijoittaminen, rahoituspäätökset, riskienhallinta ja johdannaiset.
content.sv: Rahoitusmarkkinoiden tehtävät ja rakenne, rahoituksen lähteet, arvopapereiden hinnoittelu, investointilaskelmat, tuotto ja riski, markkinoiden tehokkuus ja sijoittaminen, rahoituspäätökset, riskienhallinta ja johdannaiset.
content.en: The structure and functions of financial markets, sources of finance, pricing of securities, capital budgeting decisions, expected return and risk, market efficiency and investing, financial decisions, risk management, and derivatives.

1. Luennot 24 h,

  4. Tentti (75%), perustuu luentoihin ja luennoilla jaettavaan/erikseen ilmoitettavaan materiaaliin ja ohessa mainittuun kirjallisuuteen.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Students should be comfortable with intermediate microeconomics and with basic concepts covered in Empirical Methods for Economists (31C01200 Taloustieteen empiiriset menetelmät or 30C00200 Econometrics or 30C00500 Ekonometria, or Capstone course 31C99904 Econometrics and Data Analysis).

learningOutcomes.fi: This is a course in the economics of cities. The course covers the canonical models in urban economics. The focus in these models is households’ and firms’ locational decisions across and within cities. After the course, the student understands the main economic forces that lead to the existence of cities, and their role in agglomeration, productivity, urban amenities, and congestion. The student is familiar with key/main models of urban economics. The student is familiar with methodologies to evaluate urban characteristics, and the challenges of these methodologies. The student is familiar with the role and challenges related to housing and urban policies.

The student is familiar with the role and challenges related to housing and urban policies.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Students should be comfortable with intermediate microeconomics and with basic concepts covered in Empirical Methods for Economists (31C01200 Taloustieteen empiiriset menetelmät or 30C00200 Econometrics or 30C00500 Ekonometria, or Capstone course 31C99904 Econometrics and Data Analysis). We also recommend Microeconometrics I (31E00910) and Labor Economics I.

prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Students should be comfortable with intermediate microeconomics and with basic concepts covered in Empirical Methods for Economists (31C01200 Taloustieteen empiiriset menetelmät or 30C00200 Econometrics or 30C00500 Ekonometria, or Capstone course 31C99904 Econometrics and Data Analysis). We also recommend Microeconometrics I (31E00910) and Labor Economics I.

learningOutcomes.fi:
At the end of the course, students will be familiar with:Basic facts about: educational attainment of the workforce, returns to schooling, labor market differences between demographic groups, discrimination and anti-discrimination policies, labor taxation, subjective expectations, etc.Main theories for understanding
  • educational choices
  • differences in labor market outcomes between demographic groups
Examples of empirical work investigating these theories The course will also cover main methods used in recent research in labor economics: in particular, laboratory, experimental and structural methods.
learningOutcomes.sv:
At the end of the course, students will be familiar with:Basic facts about: educational attainment of the workforce, returns to schooling, labor market differences between demographic groups, discrimination and anti-discrimination policies, labor taxation, subjective expectations, etc.Main theories for understanding
  • educational choices
  • differences in labor market outcomes between demographic groups
Examples of empirical work investigating these theories The course will also cover main methods used in recent research in labor economics: in particular, laboratory, experimental and structural methods.
learningOutcomes.en:
At the end of the course, students will be familiar with:Basic facts about: educational attainment of the workforce, returns to schooling, labor market differences between demographic groups, discrimination and anti-discrimination policies, labor taxation, subjective expectations, etc.Main theories for understanding
  • educational choices
  • differences in labor market outcomes between demographic groups
Examples of empirical work investigating these theories The course will also cover main methods used in recent research in labor economics: in particular, laboratory, experimental and structural methods.

content.fi: The course offers a comprehensive overview of modern theoretical and empirical methods in labor economics to explore educational decisions, labor market inequalities across demographic groups, and the effects of policies like taxation and affirmative action. The course will also cover topics such as intergenerational mobility, discrimination, gender differences, and insights gained from experiments in labor economics. Structural modeling of education and job choices, as well as wage determination, will also be explored, combining theory with practical evidence.

learningOutcomes.fi: The course develops central areas of macroeconomic theory that are useful for analysis and discussion of policy making. The policy topics covered include foundations of unconventional monetary policies e.g. quantitative easing, the role of financial markets in the recent crisis, current problems and topics in the Euro area and issues in long-term economic growth. Students learn the motivations for policy analysis, become familiar with current policy concerns and acquire analytical skills for assessing these problems.
learningOutcomes.sv: The course develops central areas of macroeconomic theory that are useful for analysis and discussion of policy making. The policy topics covered include foundations of unconventional monetary policies e.g. quantitative easing, the role of financial markets in the recent crisis, current problems and topics in the Euro area and issues in long-term economic growth. Students learn the motivations for policy analysis, become familiar with current policy concerns and acquire analytical skills for assessing these problems.
learningOutcomes.en: The course develops central areas of macroeconomic theory that are useful for analysis and discussion of policy making. The policy topics covered include foundations of unconventional monetary policies e.g. quantitative easing, the role of financial markets in the recent crisis, current problems and topics in the Euro area and issues in long-term economic growth. Students learn the motivations for policy analysis, become familiar with current policy concerns and acquire analytical skills for assessing these problems.

content.fi: Formulation and use of New Keynesian models for policy making and analysis, role of financial and labor markets in macroeconomic fluctuations, the Great Recession and the problem of very low interest rates, theory of fiscal and monetary policy, analysis of long-term growth and development.
content.sv: Formulation and use of New Keynesian models for policy making and analysis, role of financial and labor markets in macroeconomic fluctuations, the Great Recession and the problem of very low interest rates, theory of fiscal and monetary policy, analysis of long-term growth and development.

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin jälkeen opiskelijalle on muodostunut jokaiselle KTM:lle tarpeelliset perustiedot Suomen verojärjestelmästä. Tämä perustietotaso luo pohjan myöhemmille vero-oikeuden opinnoille. Kurssi antaa laajamittaiset tiedot vero-oikeuden eri osa-alueiden perusteista yrityselämässä toimiville henkilöille.

content.fi: Kurssilla tutustutaan tuloverotusta säänteleviin yleisiin verotusperiaatteisiin ja käsitteisiin. Lisäksi keskitytään erityisesti yritysten, niiden omistajien ja sijoitustoiminnan verokohtelun pääpiirteisiin. Kurssi antaa lisäksi perustiedot verotusmenettelystä ja arvonlisäverotuksesta.

assesmentMethods.fi:
1. Luennot 20 h 
2. Tentti (100%) kurssikirjallisuudesta ja luennoista. Luennot ovat olennainen osa tenttiä 
3. Vapaaehtoiset tietokilpailukysymykset (quizzes) Mycourses -kurssiympäristössä, joista voi saada lisäpisteitä tenttiin.

<!--[if !supportLists]-->                <!--[endif]-->1. Lectures: 20 h<!--[if !supportLists]-->                <!--[endif]-->2. Exam (100%) based on course literature and lectures. The lectures are an essential part of the exam.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of the course, students
  • Have knowledge of important theories, models and framework related to people management and the role of external environment.  
  • Are able to analyze contemporary issues that organizations face and their implications for people management.
  • Are able to provide theoretically founded evidence-based solutions to people management challenges that take into account both organizational and environmental characteristics.
  • Have the aptitude and skills to design effective, ethical, and sustainable people management processes that allow organizations to both respond and contribute to issues arising from their external environments.

content.fi: This course introduces students to the current issues, trends and challenges that relate to managing people in organizations. Central to this course is the idea that the external environment impacts organizations in multiple, significant ways. To effectively manage people, it is crucial to be able to recognize, analyze, and adapt to the changes and developments in the external organizational environment. Examples of such issues or developments that organizations currently face include the need for increased flexibility and the associated legal, social, and organizational challenges; individualization of the employment relationship; demographic changes resulting in a more diverse workforce; technological changes and advances; sustainability & corporate social responsibility and crisis management capabilities. The course will provide students with an understanding of how these types of issues and challenges influence contemporary organizations and the skills required for successfully managing people in these environments.

prerequisites.fi: Compulsory prerequisites: MNGT-E3005 Foundations of Entrepreneurship
prerequisites.sv: Compulsory prerequisites: MNGT-E3005 Foundations of Entrepreneurship
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: MNGT-E3005 Foundations of Entrepreneurship

learningOutcomes.fi:
• Identify and describe the key characteristics of socio-economic challenges.
  • Describe how entrepreneurial processes may be applied and utilized in tackling complex socio-economic challenges.
  • Conduct and analyze primary and secondary research on real life contexts.
  • Individually, and collectively, reflect on the design and learning process throughout the course.
  • Apply design-oriented frameworks as a problem-solving approach towards socio-economic challenges.
learningOutcomes.sv:
• Identify and describe the key characteristics of socio-economic challenges.
  • Describe how entrepreneurial processes may be applied and utilized in tackling complex socio-economic challenges.
  • Conduct and analyze primary and secondary research on real life contexts.
  • Individually, and collectively, reflect on the design and learning process throughout the course.
  • Apply design-oriented frameworks as a problem-solving approach towards socio-economic challenges.
learningOutcomes.en:
• Identify and describe the key characteristics of socio-economic challenges.
  • Describe how entrepreneurial processes may be applied and utilized in tackling complex socio-economic challenges.
  • Conduct and analyze primary and secondary research on real life contexts.
  • Individually, and collectively, reflect on the design and learning process throughout the course.
  • Apply design-oriented frameworks as a problem-solving approach towards socio-economic challenges.

content.fi: Through a problem-based and iterative teaching approach, we will explore how entrepreneurial tools, frameworks, and perspectives can be utilized to understand and work with complex, societal challenges. In this course, we will look at whether entrepreneurship, as a socio-economic phenomenon, can help to begin addressing these challenges. In particular, through this course, student teams will be provided tools and guidance to 1) begin to identify and describe complex challenges, 2) conduct and analyze primary and secondary research on real-life contexts, and 3) apply design-oriented frameworks as problem-solving approaches to real-life contexts.
content.sv: Through a problem-based and iterative teaching approach, we will explore how entrepreneurial tools, frameworks, and perspectives can be utilized to understand and work with complex, societal challenges. In this course, we will look at whether entrepreneurship, as a socio-economic phenomenon, can help to begin addressing these challenges. In particular, through this course, student teams will be provided tools and guidance to 1) begin to identify and describe complex challenges, 2) conduct and analyze primary and secondary research on real-life contexts, and 3) apply design-oriented frameworks as problem-solving approaches to real-life contexts.
content.en: Through a problem-based and iterative teaching approach, we will explore how entrepreneurial tools, frameworks, and perspectives can be utilized to understand and work with complex, societal challenges. In this course, we will look at whether entrepreneurship, as a socio-economic phenomenon, can help to begin addressing these challenges. In particular, through this course, student teams will be provided tools and guidance to 1) begin to identify and describe complex challenges, 2) conduct and analyze primary and secondary research on real-life contexts, and 3) apply design-oriented frameworks as problem-solving approaches to real-life contexts.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Introduction to Statistics, Advanced course in statistics and data analytics, Mathematical tools for analytics, and data science for business I or equivalent knowledge acquired at other university level courses. These skills include basics of linear algebra, multivariate functions, differential calculus, vectors and matrices, probability theory, statistics, and basic knowledge in modelling and model selection. Some background in time series is an advantage. Prior knowledge in programming is recommended.

learningOutcomes.en: By the end of this course students should be able to:·        Identify, explain and analyse different dimensions of sustainable venture growth in the global context; ·         recognise, analyse and reflect upon the key decision-making aspects and factors affecting business growth through sustainable principles;·         apply this knowledge in practice by developing a growth/development plan for a venture solving a sustainability problem;The course will also support the development of students’ general skills in the areas of·        critical thinking and analytical writing;·        oral and written presentation;·        self-organization and team work.

content.en: The subjects covered on the course include:·         growing a new venture, growth through internationalization and networks, scalability;·         entrepreneurial opportunity and decision-making;·         dark sides of business growth;·         sustainability and entrepreneurial growth.

learningOutcomes.fi:
- Create and iterate a compelling value proposition for a new product or service aimed at business customers. - Structure techniques for demand generation and converting early adopters of entrepreneurial offerings into paying customers.- Understand and apply revenue models of new business-to-business products in global markets.- Prepare

content.fi:
In this practice-focused course, students create a Go-To-Market (GTM)  strategy and plan for a new product or service targeted at business  customers. This can be the student’s own new product, or that of an  existing (or imaginary) company. An underlying principle is that GTM  plans are always evolving to reflect the current changing reality of the  buyers' behavior and the maturity of the startup. During the  course, the students will study real-world examples of successful GTM  programs of tech startups and apply these learnings to their own GTM  plan. By
the end of this course, participants will be equipped to launch new products in
competitive global markets.

During the  course, the students will study real-world examples of successful GTM  programs of tech startups and apply these learnings to their own GTM  plan. By

competitive global markets.
content.en:
In this practice-focused course, students create a Go-To-Market (GTM) strategy and plan for a new product or service targeted at business customers. This can be the student’s own new product, or that of an existing (or imaginary) company. An underlying principle is that GTM plans are always evolving to reflect the current changing reality of the buyers' behavior and the maturity of the startup. During the course, the students will study real-world examples of successful GTM programs of tech startups and apply these learnings to their own GTM plan. By
the end of this course, participants will be equipped to launch new products in
competitive global markets.

prerequisites.fi: Compulsory prerequisites: Basic and intermediate studies in general and inorganic chemistry
prerequisites.sv: Compulsory prerequisites: Basic and intermediate studies in general and inorganic chemistry
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: Basic and intermediate studies in general and inorganic chemistry

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student will be able to
  1. Apply the basic concepts of structural chemistry, such as unit cell, lattice parameters, crystal system, and space group.
  2. Search crystal structures of inorganic solid-state compounds from databases, analyze and visualize the crystal structures.
  3. Analyze bonding in solid state chemistry: Electronegativity, radii and packing of atoms, ligand field theory, band theory.
  4. Describe synthesis methods used in solid state chemistry and read the information given in various phase diagrams.
  5. Analyze information from various structure characterization methods and utilize powder X-ray diffraction data for phase identification.
  6. Explain basic structure-property correlations of various inorganic materials.
learningOutcomes.sv:
After the course the student will be able to
  1. Apply the basic concepts of structural chemistry, such as unit cell, lattice parameters, crystal system, and space group.
  2. Search crystal structures of inorganic solid-state compounds from databases, analyze and visualize the crystal structures.
  3. Analyze bonding in solid state chemistry: Electronegativity, radii and packing of atoms, ligand field theory, band theory.
  4. Describe synthesis methods used in solid state chemistry and read the information given in various phase diagrams.
  5. Analyze information from various structure characterization methods and utilize powder X-ray diffraction data for phase identification.
  6. Explain basic structure-property correlations of various inorganic materials.
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student will be able to
  1. Apply the basic concepts of structural chemistry, such as unit cell, lattice parameters, crystal system, and space group.
  2. Search crystal structures of inorganic solid-state compounds from databases, analyze and visualize the crystal structures.
  3. Analyze bonding in solid state chemistry: Electronegativity, radii and packing of atoms, ligand field theory, band theory.
  4. Describe synthesis methods used in solid state chemistry and read the information given in various phase diagrams.
  5. Analyze information from various structure characterization methods and utilize powder X-ray diffraction data for phase identification.
  6. Explain basic structure-property correlations of various inorganic materials.

content.fi:
Structure, bonding, synthesis, and characterization of solid state materials.
Use of crystal structure databases, visualization of crystal structures, interpretation of phase diagrams, and phase identification with powder X-ray diffraction data.
Application of the above core concepts to various main group and d-metal compounds.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Recommended: - CHEM-E3140 Bioprocess technology II / CHEM-E3115 Industrial Biotechnology - CHEM-E3130 Biolab II / CHEM-E3116 Laboratory Course in Industrial Biotechnology
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Recommended: - CHEM-E3140 Bioprocess technology II / CHEM-E3115 Industrial Biotechnology - CHEM-E3130 Biolab II / CHEM-E3116 Laboratory Course in Industrial Biotechnology
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Recommended: - CHEM-E3140 Bioprocess technology II / CHEM-E3115 Industrial Biotechnology - CHEM-E3130 Biolab II / CHEM-E3116 Laboratory Course in Industrial Biotechnology

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student has the ability to:
1. Present the physical basis for the function of biological macromolecules.
2. Demonstrate the thermodynamic basis for biological interactions, kinetics, and functions.
3. Understand the use of thermodynamic models for predicting the outcome of biological processes. 4. Describe  analytical techniques for studying biological molecules and their biophysical behavior. 5. Apply the above knowledge to food science, medical technology, bioanalytical measurements, biomaterials processing, and bioscience research.
learningOutcomes.sv:
After the course the student has the ability to:1. Present the physical basis for the function of biological macromolecules.2. Demonstrate the thermodynamic basis for biological interactions, kinetics, and functions.3. Understand the use of thermodynamic models for predicting the outcome of biological processes.
4. Describe  analytical techniques for studying biological molecules and their biophysical behavior.
5. Apply the above knowledge to food science, medical technology, bioanalytical measurements, biomaterials processing, and bioscience research.
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student has the ability to:1. Present the physical basis for the function of biological macromolecules.2. Demonstrate the thermodynamic basis for biological interactions, kinetics, and functions.3. Understand the use of thermodynamic models for predicting the outcome of biological processes.
4. Describe  analytical techniques for studying biological molecules and their biophysical behavior.
5. Apply the above knowledge to food science, medical technology, bioanalytical measurements, biomaterials processing, and bioscience research.

content.fi: Protein structure and folding, and evolution. Theoretical and practical aspects of methods for the separation and characterization of biological macromolecules. The processes of sedimentation, diffusion and aggregation. Using calorimetry and analytical techniques to study molecular interactions. The application of thermodynamics in biological systems. The thermodynamic basis for cellular conversion and metabolism. The thermodynamic basis for macromolecular behavior and interactions. Mathematical models to understand interactions, including cooperative effects.
content.sv: Protein structure and folding, and evolution. Theoretical and practical aspects of methods for the separation and characterization of biological macromolecules. The processes of sedimentation, diffusion and aggregation. Using calorimetry and analytical techniques to study molecular interactions. The application of thermodynamics in biological systems. The thermodynamic basis for cellular conversion and metabolism. The thermodynamic basis for macromolecular behavior and interactions. Mathematical models to understand interactions, including cooperative effects.
content.en: Protein structure and folding, and evolution. Theoretical and practical aspects of methods for the separation and characterization of biological macromolecules. The processes of sedimentation, diffusion and aggregation. Using calorimetry and analytical techniques to study molecular interactions. The application of thermodynamics in biological systems. The thermodynamic basis for cellular conversion and metabolism. The thermodynamic basis for macromolecular behavior and interactions. Mathematical models to understand interactions, including cooperative effects.

Demonstrate the thermodynamic basis for biological interactions, kinetics, and functions.3. Understand the use of thermodynamic models for predicting the outcome of biological processes.
4. Describe  analytical techniques for studying biological molecules and their biophysical behavior.
5. Apply the above knowledge to food science, medical technology, bioanalytical measurements, biomaterials processing, and bioscience research.

content.fi: Protein structure and folding, and evolution. Theoretical and practical aspects of methods for the separation and characterization of biological macromolecules. The processes of sedimentation, diffusion and aggregation. Using calorimetry and analytical techniques to study molecular interactions. The application of thermodynamics in biological systems. The thermodynamic basis for cellular conversion and metabolism. The thermodynamic basis for macromolecular behavior and interactions. Mathematical models to understand interactions, including cooperative effects.
content.sv: Protein structure and folding, and evolution. Theoretical and practical aspects of methods for the separation and characterization of biological macromolecules. The processes of sedimentation, diffusion and aggregation. Using calorimetry and analytical techniques to study molecular interactions. The application of thermodynamics in biological systems. The thermodynamic basis for cellular conversion and metabolism. The thermodynamic basis for macromolecular behavior and interactions. Mathematical models to understand interactions, including cooperative effects.
content.en: Protein structure and folding, and evolution. Theoretical and practical aspects of methods for the separation and characterization of biological macromolecules. The processes of sedimentation, diffusion and aggregation. Using calorimetry and analytical techniques to study molecular interactions. The application of thermodynamics in biological systems. The thermodynamic basis for cellular conversion and metabolism. The thermodynamic basis for macromolecular behavior and interactions. Mathematical models to understand interactions, including cooperative effects.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student will be able to
1. explain the basic features of the transition metal chemistry
2. derive the basic chemical and physical properties of d-block and f-block transition metals from their electron structures
3. describe the most important compounds of transition elements and name their applications
4. find and read basic scientific literature on a given topic related to the chemistry of elements

learningOutcomes.fi:
• Familiarize with materials that are processed either chemically or mechanically from trees or other plants, such as cellulose fibres, fibrils (micro- or nano-structured), lignin, bark extractives and novel combinations of these
  • The ability to develop innovative ideas through hands-on prototyping and experimenting with materials
  • Awareness of the main sustainability issues related to this field
  • Understand the principles of scaling the ideas towards innovations and even commercialisation
  • Experience of an interdisciplinary working environment in practice

content.fi:
Nordic Biomaterials by CHEMARTS inspires students to combine design and material science for new cellulose-driven concepts and ideas. Combining natural materials with advanced technologies offer new possibilities for sustainable development within existing and emerging industries.
This graduate-level course teaches students with varying backgrounds (design, science, engineering, business) to combine design with material research. It introduces a broad spectrum of biomaterials, especially wood-and plant-based. During the course, students familiarise themselves with practice-based material research, experience how interdisciplinary material research happens in practice, and explore how raw materials could be turned into innovative business ideas in the context of the circular economy.
