prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: 110 op kandidaatintutkintoon kuuluvia opintoja, perus- ja pääaineopinnot pääosin suoritettu. Kurssille ilmoittautuessa seuraavat kurssit tulee olla suoritettuna: - CHEM-A1100 Teollisuuden toimintaympäristö ja prosessit - CHEM-A1120 Virtaustekniikka ja lämmönsiirto - CHEM-A1270 Yleinen kemia - CHEM-A1280 Kemian peruslaboratoriotyöt - CHEM-A1290 Orgaanisen kemian peruskurssi - CHEM-A1205 Orgaanisen kemian laboratoriotyöt - CHEM-A1310 Biotieteen perusteet - CHEM-A1410 Materiaalitieteen perusteet - CHEM-C2270 Termodynamiikka - CHEM-C2280 Termodynamiikan laboratoriotyöt
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: 110 sp studier som hör till kandidatexamen, största delen av grundstudierna och huvudämnestudierna bör vara avlagda. Vid anmälning till kursen bör följande kurser vara avlagda: - CHEM-A1100 Teollisuuden toimintaympäristö ja prosessit - CHEM-A1120 Virtaustekniikka ja lämmönsiirto - CHEM-A1270 Yleinen kemia - CHEM-A1280 Kemian peruslaboratoriotyöt - CHEM-A1290 Orgaanisen kemian peruskurssi - CHEM-A1205 Orgaanisen kemian laboratoriotyöt - CHEM-A1310 Biotieteen perusteet - CHEM-A1410 Materiaalitieteen perusteet - CHEM-C2270 Termodynamiikka - CHEM-C2280 Termodynamiikan laboratoriotyöt
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: 110 cr of bachelor studies, basic and major studies largely completed. The following courses must be completed when signing up for the course: - CHEM-A1100 Teollisuuden toimintaympäristö ja prosessit - CHEM-A1120 Virtaustekniikka ja lämmönsiirto - CHEM-A1270 Yleinen kemia - CHEM-A1280 Kemian peruslaboratoriotyöt - CHEM-A1290 Orgaanisen kemian peruskurssi - CHEM-A1205 Orgaanisen kemian laboratoriotyöt - CHEM-A1310 Biotieteen perusteet - CHEM-A1410 Materiaalitieteen perusteet - CHEM-C2270 Termodynamiikka - CHEM-C2280 Termodynamiikan laboratoriotyöt

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suorittamisen jälkeen opiskelija osaa
  • Soveltaa tutkimusprojektissa tarvittuja tutkimusmenetelmiä.
  • Etsiä tietoa tieteellisestä kirjallisuudesta ja hyödyntää tietoa tutkimustyössä.
  • Analysoida tutkimustuloksia, verrata niitä aiempaan tutkimuskirjallisuuteen aiheesta ja raportoida tulokset hyvien tieteellisten käytäntöjen mukaisesti.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter avslutad kurs ska studenten kunna:
  • Tillämpa forskningsmetoder som är nödvändiga för forskningsprojektet
  • Söka information från vetenskaplig litteratur och använda informationen i forskningsarbetet.
  • Analysera forskningsresultat, jämföra dem med tidigare litteratur och rapportera resultaten enligt god vetenskaplig praxis
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student will be able to:
  • Apply research methods necessary for the research project
  • Search information from scientific literature and utilize the information in research work.
  • Analyze research results, compare them with previous literature, and report the results according to good scientific practice

content.fi:
Itsenäinen tutkimustyö Kemian tekniikan korkeakoulun tutkimusryhmässä. Lisätietoja kurssin suorittamisesta kurssin MyCourses-sivulla.
Tutkimusprojektin voi yhdistää kandidaatintyöhön, jolloin tutkimusprojektin tulokset raportoidaan kandidaatintyön kokeellisena osana.
content.sv:
Självständigt forskningsarbete i en forskargrupp vid Högskolan för kemiteknik. Se MyCourses för praktiska instruktioner om hur kursen ska genomföras.
Det är möjligt att kombinera forskningsprojektet med kandidatarbetet, i vilket fall resultaten av forskningsprojektet rapporteras som den experimentella delen av kandidatarbetet.
content.en:
Independent research work in a research group of the School of Chemical Engineering. See MyCourses for practical instructions on how to complete the course.
It is possible to combine the research project with Bachelor Thesis, in which case the results of the research project are reported as the experimental part of the thesis.

assesmentMethods.en: Evaluation criteria are the practical execution of the research work and a written report.

workload.fi: 5 op = 135 hKontaktiopetus (40-50 h):- Luennot - LaskuharjoituksetOma työ (82-92 h):- Itsenäinen opiskeluTentti 3 h
workload.sv: 5 sp = 135 hKontaktundervisning (40-50 h):- Föreläsningar - RäkneövningarEget arbete (82-92 h):- Självständiga studierTentamen 3 h
workload.en: 5 cr = 135 h Contact teaching 40-50 h- Lectures- Calculation exercisesSelf-study 82-92 hExam 3 h

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: Kemiantekniikan kandidaattiohjelman pakolliset differentiaali ja integraalilaskennan kurssit I ja II
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: Kurserna I och II i differential- och integralkalkyl, som är obligatoriska i kandidatprogrammet i kemiteknik
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Compulsory courses of differential and integral calculus I and II of the Bachelor program

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija osaa: - kirjoittaa ja ratkaista reaktion nopeusyhtälön, myös usean samanaikaisen reaktion tapauksessa
- muuntaa dynaamisen systeemin matemaattiseen muotoon ja ratkaista ongelman
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen ska den studerande kunna:
- ställa upp och lösa hastighetsekvationen för kemiska reaktioner, också i de fall då flera reaktioner sker samtidigt- modellera dynamiska system matematiskt och lösa problemet
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course, the student can:
- write down and solve the reaction rate equation, also in the case of several simultaneous reactions- describe a dynamic system in a mathematical form and solve the problem

content.fi:
Reaktiokinetiikkaa:
- reaktion nopeuslakien ja kertaluokkien määrääminen- reaktiomekanismit lähtien alkeisreaktioista- reaktioyhtälöiden ratkaisu: nopeutta rajoittava vaihe, välituotteen stationääritilaoletus- Arrheniuksen yhtälö, absoluuttisten reaktionopeuksien teoria- reaktiosysteemien, ts. usean samanaikaisen reaktion ratkaisu
Kuljetusta:
- diffuusio- sähkönkuljetus, johtokyky; ionien assosiaatio- reaktion ja kuljetuksen kytkeytyminen (heterogeeniset reaktiot)
Muita dynaamisia systeemejä, esimerkkejä:
- oskilloivat reaktiot (Belousov Zabotinsky)- Lotka Volterra (prey predator) bakteerikasvun dynamiikka (resurssien rajoittama kasvu)
content.sv:
Reaktionskinetik:
- bestämning av hastighetslag och reaktionsordning- reaktionsmekanismer utgående från elementarreaktioner - lösning av hastighetsekvationer: hastighetsbestämmande steg, steady-state approximationen för mellanprodukter- Arrhenius ekvation, teorin för absoluta reaktionshastigheter- lösning av reaktionssystem, dvs. flera parallella reaktioner
Transport:
- diffusion- transport av elektrisk ström, ledningsförmåga; association av joner- koppling mellan reaktion och transport (heterogena reaktioner)
Övriga dynamiska system, till exempel:
- oscillerande reaktioner (Belousov-Zabotinsky)- Lotka Volterra (prey predator) populationsdynamik hos bakterier (tillväxt som begränsas av resurserna)
content.en:
Reaction kinetics:
- determination of reaction rate laws and orders- reaction mechanisms starting from  elementary reactions- solving of reaction equations: rate determining step, stationary state assumption of intermediates- Arrhenius equation, theory of absolute reaction rates- reaction systems, i.e. solution of multiple simultaneous reactions
Transport:
- diffusion- charge transport, migration, conductivity; ion association- coupling of reactions with transport (heterogeneous reactions)
Other dynamic systems, for example:
- oscillating reactions (Belousov-Zabotinsky)- Lotka-Volterra (prey-predator), dynamics of bacterial growth (growth limited by resources)

assesmentMethods.fi: Luennot, kotitehtävät ja tentti.
assesmentMethods.sv: Föreläsningar, hemuppgifter och tentamen.
assesmentMethods.en: Lectures, home exercises and an exam.

Jos toteutus perutaan, tulee opiskelijoille tarjota vaihtoehtoinen tapa suorittaa kurssi, tai ehdotus muusta soveltuvasta suoritettavasta kurssista.

Om studiemomentet inte arrangeras i vanlig ordning, bör studerandena erbjudas ett alternativt sätt att avlägga kursen, eller erbjudas alternativ på andra lämpliga kurser att avlägga.

In the case of cancelled course implementations, the students enrolled to them must be provided with an alternative way of completing the course or be advised to take some other applicable course.

workload.fi:
• Opetettavan kurssin kurssiapulaisten koulutukseen/perehdytykseen osallistuminen.
  • Opetettavan kurssin asiasisältöihin ja opetusmateriaaleihin perehtyminen.
  • Kontaktiopetus opetettavalla kurssilla sopimuksen mukaan.
  • Raportti opetuksesta.
workload.sv:
• Du deltar i kursassistentutbildningen för den kurs som undervisas.
  • Du bekantar dig med undervisningsmaterialet för kursen.
  • Du tar hand om kontaktundervisning på kursen enligt överenskommelse.
  • Du skriver en rapport på undervisningen.
workload.en:
• Participating in the teaching assistant training of the course being taught
  • Getting familiar with the teaching materials on the course.
  • Contact teaching on a course as agreed.
  • Teaching report

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: -
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: -
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: -

learningOutcomes.fi:
• Olet saanut kokemusta kurssin sisältöjen ja asiaosaamisesi soveltamisesta ohjaustehtävässä.
  • Osaat tarkkailla ohjaustyötä tiimityöskentelyn ja vertaisoppimisen näkökulmasta.
  • Osaat tunnistaa kurssilla tapahtuvan ohjaustyön keskeisiä vaatimuksia.
learningOutcomes.sv:
• Du får erfarenhet av att tillämpa kursinnehåll och ditt kunnande inom undervisning.
  • Du kan observera handledningsarbetet ur såväl teamarbetets som ömsesidiga lärandets synvinkel.
  • Du känner igen de centrala kraven för handledning på en kurs.
learningOutcomes.en:
• You have gained experience of applying the course content and your knowledge in teaching.
  • You are able to observe teacher's work in relation to teamwork and peer-learning.
  • You are able to recognize central requirements of teaching in a course.

additionalInformation.fi: Opetuskieli: suomi Opetusperiodi: 2024-2025 Syksy I - Kesä   2025-2026 Syksy I - Kesä  Ilmoittautuminen: Ilmoittautuminen opetettavan kurssin vastuuopettajalle Kemian tekniikan korkeakoulun kurssiapulaishaun kautta (järjestetään keväisin). Vastuuopettajat valitsevat kurssiapulaiset omille kursseilleen ja kurssiapulaisten paikkoja on rajoitettu määrä. Kurssin toteutus voidaan perua, jos kyseiselle toteutukselle ilmoittautuneita opiskelijoita on alle viisi. Jos toteutus perutaan, tulee opiskelijoille tarjota vaihtoehtoinen tapa suorittaa kurssi, tai ehdotus muusta soveltuvasta suoritettavasta kurssista.

Anmälan sker via ansökan till kursassistent vid Högskolan för kemiteknik (ansökan ordnas varje vår). Kursassistenterna väljs av de ansvariga lärarna och det finns ett begränsat antal platser. Kursens studiemoment kan ställas in ifall under fem studerande har anmält sig till studiemomentet i fråga. Om studiemomentet inte arrangeras i vanlig ordning, bör studerandena erbjudas ett alternativt sätt att avlägga kursen, eller erbjudas alternativ på andra lämpliga kurser att avlägga.

additionalInformation.fi:
Kun suoritat kurssin ensimmäistä kertaa, ja:
  • suoritus sisällytetään kanditutkintoon: ilmoittaudu toteutukselle CHEM-C2000
  • suoritus sisällytetään maisteritutkintoon: ilmoittaudu toteutukselle CHEM-E0125
Kun suoritat kurssin toista kertaa:
  • suoritus sisällytetään kanditutkintoon: ilmoittaudu toteutukselle CHEM-C2000001
  • suoritus sisällytetään maisteritutkintoon: ilmoittaudu toteutukselle CHEM-E0125001
Jos haluat suorittaa kurssin useammin kuin kaksi kertaa, olethan yhteydessä kurssin vastuuopettajaan sopiaksesi suorituksesta. Perehdytyksen opetustehtäviin ja opetusmateriaaleihin hoitaa opetettavan kurssin vastuuopettaja. Kurssin voi suorittaa useita kertoja (enintään 10 op edestä kandidaattiopintojen aikana). Jokaisesta opetetusta kurssista saa 2 opintopistettä. Opintopisteiden saaminen tapahtuu seuraavasti: 1. Opiskelija ilmoittautuu kurssille sen mukaan, mihin tutkintoon opetuksen opintopisteet aiotaan sisällyttää: Jos pisteet sisällytetään kanditutkintoon, ilmoittaudutaan kurssille Kurssiapulaisena Kemian tekniikan korkeakoulussa (CHEM-C2000). Jos taas opintopisteet sisällytetään maisteritutkintoon, ilmoittaudutaan kurssille Teaching Assistant Duties at the School of Chemical Engineering (CHEM-E0125). 2. Kun opetustehtävä on päättynyt, opiskelija täyttää huolella kyseisen kurssin MyCourses-sivulla olevan raporttipohjan. 3. Kurssin vastuuopettaja lukee raporttisi läpi ja hyväksyy sen. Hyväksyttyjen raporttien perusteella opintopisteet kirjataan rekisteriin syys- ja kevätlukukausien jälkeen. Opetuskieli : suomi Opetusperiodi : 2022-2023 Syksy I - Kesä 2023-2024 Syksy I - Kesä Ilmoittautuminen : Ilmoittautuminen opetettavan kurssin vastuuopettajalle Kemian tekniikan korkeakoulun kurssiapulaishaun kautta (järjestetään keväisin). Vastuuopettajat valitsevat kurssiapulaiset omille kursseilleen ja kurssiapulaisten paikkoja on rajoitettu määrä.Kurssin toteutus voidaan perua, jos kyseiselle toteutukselle ilmoittautuneita opiskelijoita on alle viisi. Jos toteutus perutaan, tulee opiskelijoille tarjota vaihtoehtoinen tapa suorittaa kurssi, tai ehdotus muusta soveltuvasta suoritettavasta kurssista.
additionalInformation.sv:
När du genomför kursen för första gången, och:
  • Kursen inkluderas i din kandidatexamen: anmäl dig till studieavsnittet CHEM-C2000
  • Kursen inkluderas i din magisterexamen: anmäl dig till studieavsnittet CHEM-E0125
När du genomför kursen för andra gången, och:
  • Kursen inkluderas i din kandidatexamen: anmäl dig till studieavsnittet CHEM-C2000001
  • Kursen inkluderas i din magisterexamen: anmäl dig till studieavsnittet CHEM-E0125001
Om du vill utföra kursen flera gånger än två, vänligen kontakta kursens ansvariga lärare för att komma överens om genomförandet. Introduktion och handledning till undervisningsuppgifterna och -materialet sköts av den ansvariga läraren för den undervisade kursen. Kursen kan avläggas flera gånger (upp till 10sp under kandidatstudierna). Studeranden får 2 studiepoäng per undervisad kurs. 1. Studeranden anmäler sig till rätt kurs, beroende på till vilken examen studiepoängen för undervisningen ska inkluderas i. Om studiepoängen ska inkluderas i kandidatexamen, anmäler sig studeranden till Kursassistent i Högskolan för kemiteknik (CHEM-C2000). Om studiepoängena ska till magisterexamen, anmäler man sig till Teaching Assistant Duties at the School of Chemical Engineering (CHEM-E0125). 2. När undervisningsuppgifterna tagit slut fyller studeranden noggrant i rapportbottnet som finns på kursens MyCourses-sida. 3. Kursens ansvariga lärare läser igenom rapporten och godkänner den. På basis av de godkända rapporterna registreras studiepoängena efter vår- och höstterminen.  Undervisningsspråket : finska Undervisningsperiod : 2022-2023 Höst I - Sommar 2023-2024 Höst I - Sommar Anmälning : Anmälan till den ansvariga läraren för den kurs som undervisas. Anmälan sker via ansökan till kursassistent vid högskolan för kemiteknik (ansökan ordnas varje vår). Kursassistenterna väljs av de ansvariga lärarna och det finns ett begränsat antal platser.Kursens studiemoment kan ställas in ifall under fem studerande har anmält sig till studiemomentet i fråga. Om studiemomentet inte arrangeras i vanlig ordning, bör studerandena erbjudas ett alternativt sätt att avlägga kursen, eller erbjudas alternativ på andra lämpliga kurser att avlägga.
additionalInformation.en:
When completing the course for the first time, and:
  • the credits are to be included in your BSc degree: register to the course CHEM-C2000
  • the credits are to be included in your MSc degree: register to the course CHEM-E0125
When completing the course for the second time, and:
  • the credits are to be included in your BSc degree: register to the course CHEM-C2000001
  • the credits are to be included in your MSc degree: register to the course CHEM-E0125001
If you wish to complete the course more than two times, please contact the teacher in charge of the course to agree on completion. The course can be taken several times (for up to 10 cr during the BSc studies). Each taught course awards credits. Credits can be obtained as follows:
  1. The student enrolls on a teaching assistant course based on the degree they wants to include the credits in. If the credits are to be a part of a bachelor s degree, the student enrolls in the course Kurssiapulaisena Kemian tekniikan korkeakoulussa (CHEM-C2000). If the credits are to be a part of a master s degree, the student enrolls in Teaching Assistant Duties at the School of Chemical Engineering (CHEM-E0125).
  2. After the teaching has concluded, the student carefully fills out the report form for teaching assistants. The form can be found in the MyCourses-page of the course selected at step 1.
  3. The responsible teacher reads the report and accepts it. The credits are awarded based on the accepted reports after the spring and autumn periods.
Teaching Language : Finnish Teaching Period : 2022-2023 Autumn I - Summer 2023-2024 Autumn I - Summer Enrollment : Agreed with the responsible teacher of the course to be taught. Registration via the School of Chemical Engineering teaching assistant call (arranged every Spring). The teaching assistants are selected by the responsible teachers and there is a limited amount of positions available.A course implementation may be cancelled if the number of students enrolled to the course implementation does not meet the required minimum of five students. In the case of cancelled course implementations, the students enrolled to them must be provided with an alternative way of completing the course or be advised to take some other applicable course.

, Jos haluat suorittaa kurssin useammin kuin kaksi kertaa, olethan yhteydessä kurssin vastuuopettajaan sopiaksesi suorituksesta. , Perehdytyksen opetustehtäviin ja opetusmateriaaleihin hoitaa opetettavan kurssin vastuuopettaja. Kurssin voi suorittaa useita kertoja (enintään 10 op edestä kandidaattiopintojen aikana). Jokaisesta opetetusta kurssista saa 2 opintopistettä. , Opintopisteiden saaminen tapahtuu seuraavasti: , 1. Opiskelija ilmoittautuu kurssille sen mukaan, mihin tutkintoon opetuksen opintopisteet aiotaan sisällyttää: Jos pisteet sisällytetään kanditutkintoon, ilmoittaudutaan kurssille Kurssiapulaisena Kemian tekniikan korkeakoulussa (CHEM-C2000). Jos taas opintopisteet sisällytetään maisteritutkintoon, ilmoittaudutaan kurssille Teaching Assistant Duties at the School of Chemical Engineering (CHEM-E0125). , 2. Kun opetustehtävä on päättynyt, opiskelija täyttää huolella kyseisen kurssin MyCourses-sivulla olevan raporttipohjan. , 3. Kurssin vastuuopettaja lukee raporttisi läpi ja hyväksyy sen. Hyväksyttyjen raporttien perusteella opintopisteet kirjataan rekisteriin syys- ja kevätlukukausien jälkeen., Opetuskieli : suomi, Opetusperiodi : 2022-2023 Syksy I - Kesä
2023-2024 Syksy I - Kesä , Ilmoittautuminen : , Ilmoittautuminen opetettavan kurssin vastuuopettajalle Kemian tekniikan korkeakoulun kurssiapulaishaun kautta (järjestetään keväisin). Vastuuopettajat valitsevat kurssiapulaiset omille kursseilleen ja kurssiapulaisten paikkoja on rajoitettu määrä.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E3130 Biolab II, CHEM-E3116 Laboratory Course in Industrial Biotechnology or similar
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E3130 Biolab II, CHEM-E3116 Laboratory Course in Industrial Biotechnology or similar
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E3130 Biolab II, CHEM-E3116 Laboratory Course in Industrial Biotechnology or similar

learningOutcomes.fi:
After completing the course students will be able to:
1. build kinetic simulation models of the cell growth and product formation
2. connect different models together to build a bioprocess model
3. define parameters for kinetic and static bioprocess models
4. create experimental designs for bioprocess screening and optimization tests
5. create response surface models and define optimum variable values thereof
6. create multivariate models from various data sources including e.g. raw materials, cultivation conditions, product properties, expression data
7. utilize certain chemometric modelling approaches for bioprocess estimation and simulation simulations
8. design simple experiments to find out certain kinetic and optimization parameters of a bioprocess
9. estimate the model validity in various cases
learningOutcomes.sv: After completing the course students will be able to: 1. build kinetic simulation models of the cell growth and product formation 2. connect different models together to build a bioprocess model 3. define parameters for kinetic and static bioprocess models 4. create experimental designs for bioprocess screening and optimization tests 5. create response surface models and define optimum variable values thereof 6. create multivariate models from various data sources including e.g. raw materials, cultivation conditions, product properties, expression data 7. utilize certain chemometric modelling approaches for bioprocess estimation and simulation simulations 8. design simple experiments to find out certain kinetic and optimization parameters of a bioprocess 9. estimate the model validity in various cases

content.fi: Bioprocess behavior in different modes and modeling principles combined to experimental works. Computer-aided bioprocess modeling and simulation. Creating bioprocess models in MATLAB and Simulink environment. Linear and non-linear estimation of the kinetic parameters for types and models. Multivariate modeling possibilities and limitations. Response surface modeling, principal component analysis, neural networks. Use of models as a part of Quality control as process analytical technique. Creating a bioprocess simulation model and validating model parameters.

Creating a bioprocess simulation model and validating model parameters.

learningOutcomes.fi:
-    The student knows the capabilities and limitations of major materials and surface characterization techniques
-    The student can select the most proper materials characterization methods for particular sample
-    The student can critically evaluate the material characterization methods used in research papers
-    The student can perform data analysis on the results obtained in laboratory experiments
learningOutcomes.sv: -    The student knows the capabilities and limitations of major materials and surface characterization techniques-    The student can select the most proper materials characterization methods for particular sample-    The student can critically evaluate the material characterization methods used in research papers-    The student can perform data analysis on the results obtained in laboratory experiments
learningOutcomes.en: -    The student knows the capabilities and limitations of major materials and surface characterization techniques-    The student can select the most proper materials characterization methods for particular sample-    The student can critically evaluate the material characterization methods used in research papers-    The student can perform data analysis on the results obtained in laboratory experiments

content.fi: In this course, the student can exploit the most common materials characterization methods to characterize the structure and physical properties of materials. The student can evaluate the capabilities and limitations of major materials and surface characterization techniques such as: Optical microscopy, Raman, Four Probe Resistivity and Hall Measurement, XRD, AFM, TEM, SEM, EDS, XPS, Auger, SIMS.

The student can evaluate the capabilities and limitations of major materials and surface characterization techniques such as: Optical microscopy, Raman, Four Probe Resistivity and Hall Measurement, XRD, AFM, TEM, SEM, EDS, XPS, Auger, SIMS.
content.en: In this course, the student can exploit the most common materials characterization methods to characterize the structure and physical properties of materials. The student can evaluate the capabilities and limitations of major materials and surface characterization techniques such as: Optical microscopy, Raman, Four Probe Resistivity and Hall Measurement, XRD, AFM, TEM, SEM, EDS, XPS, Auger, SIMS.

assesmentMethods.fi: Weekly lecture, 5 laboratory projects, written reports (five laboratory reports with each report is of 12 marks and in total 60 marks), examination (36 marks), feedback (4 marks) Examination: End semester exam (36 marks) (explain a method 16 marks +  A real case study 20 marks) (1)explain a method 16 marks:  You have to choose one method through a lottery from my hat and present it during the exam in 10 minutes (2) A real case study 20 marks: Choose a published paper from mycourses  read it and make a presentation and present during the exam

Registration:

The maximum number of students is 30. Functional Materials and Chemistry and Materials Science major students are a priority.

A course implementation may be cancelled if the number of students enrolled to the course implementation does not meet the required minimum of five students. In the case of cancelled course implementations, the students enrolled to them must be provided with an alternative way of completing the course or be advised to take some other applicable course.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: - CHEM-E3190 Metabolism AND - CHEM-E8120 Cell Biology OR CHEM-E3121 Microbial Physiology AND - CHEM-E3111 Cell Engineering
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: - CHEM-E3190 Metabolism AND - CHEM-E8120 Cell Biology OR CHEM-E3121 Microbial Physiology AND - CHEM-E3111 Cell Engineering

learningOutcomes.fi:
On completion of this course, the student will be able to:
  1. Appraise the core concepts and principles of synthetic biology.
  2. Design synthetic biological systems with specified functions, considering modularity and standardization principles.
  3. Apply computational tools for modeling biological systems and analyzing biological data.
  4. Analyze literature and communicate scientific ideas on current topics in synthetic biology.
  5. Understand regulatory and safety guidelines governing the use of synthetic biology.

  4. Analyze literature and communicate scientific ideas on current topics in synthetic biology.

content.fi: This course combines principles from biology, engineering, computer science, and other disciplines to design and construct new biological entities, systems, or functions that do not exist in nature or to redesign existing biological systems for useful purposes.

learningOutcomes.fi:
The aim of the AMIS Summer School is to: 
  • Develop the students' knowledge on creativity and innovation techniques upon hands-on practices for case studies based on the Inno-Project topics 
  • Develop their knowledge on employing a concept of Design Thinking with an entrepreneurial toolbox for comprehensive problem-solving approaches to result in innovative products/services 
  • Develop and utilize their knowledge on advanced materials and technologies to bring added value to products/services having sustainability in product and market wises 
  • Learn to communicate, work and innovate in close relation and collaboration with students and entrepreneurial teachers upon intensive brainstorming 
  • Create interfaces with other students and company representatives that are vital for team belonging, entrepreneurial mindset and networking 
  • Develop presentation and communication skills via management and team working and pitching for academic and commercial audiences. 
AMIS Summer School is also an important networking event for students with academic staff.

content.fi:
The programme includes lectures, presentations, group work and hands on activities. The AMIS Summer School program is built around students working on commercialization of technologies and products in Europe. The technologies or products that the students work on are provided by case companies operating in some of the industries covered by the Raw materials KIC.  The overall program consists of 4 parts: 
  1. Innovation and Entrepreneurship pre-study on-line module. The module is implemented based on the I&E Online learning material of EIT Digital. Workload 10 hours, 1-2 calendar weeks. 
  2. Case pre-study. The backbone of the studies is formed by the commercialization cases based on the Inno-Project. In the pre-study, the students analyze their local/domestic market for five of the cases. Workload 15 hours, 1-2 calendar weeks. 
  3. One week intensive study session at Aalto. Based on the customer and market input gathered in the Case pre-study, the student teams define initial solution for a startup. Workload 40 hours, 1 calendar week. 
  4. Concept validation and final report. In this phase, the students do validation of the concept with potential customers in their local/domestic market. The results of the validations are compiled by each team into final report, 15 hours, 1-2 calendar weeks.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student
  • knows the most common natural and synthetic biodegradable polymers
  • can define what is biodegradation and how it is measured
  • can describe the synthesis methods of synthetic biodegradable polymers
  • knows the application areas and particular requirements of biodegradable polymers

content.fi: This Graduate level course deals with the general topic of biopolymers. In this context, this is an introductory course in which Biopolymers indicate those derived from renewable resources (bio-based), either biodegradable or non-biodegradable, and polymers derived from non-renewable resources that are biodegradable. It also includes those polymers produced by biological systems such as microorganisms, plants, or animals, or obtained by chemical synthesis. Fundamentals of the physical chemistry are brought to life with examples from such fields as biotechnology, paper science, biomaterials, etc. Topics include Synthetic Biopolymers, Biodegradation, (bacterial) Cellulose, Polypeptides, etc.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E6130 Metal Recycling Technologies (5 cr) and CHEM-E6155 Circular Economy for Materials Processing (5 cr), recommended for students in the Sustainable Metals Processing major. For others, a strong background in one's own field (design, business, engineering).
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E6130 Metal Recycling Technologies (5 cr) and CHEM-E6155 Circular Economy for Materials Processing (5 cr), recommended for students in the Sustainable Metals Processing major. For others, a strong background in one's own field (design, business, engineering).
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E6130 Metal Recycling Technologies (5 cr) and CHEM-E6155 Circular Economy for Materials Processing (5 cr), recommended for students in the Sustainable Metals Processing major. For others, a strong background in one's own field (design, business, engineering).

learningOutcomes.fi: After completing the course, the student can: - rationalize the principles of circular economy and their relevance in the production and processing of raw materials - create new designs for product/process/service that follows the circular economy principles - identify opportunities for value-generation from activities supporting circular economy and develop an entrepreneurial mindset - use models for recycling processes to evaluate their feasibility, efficiency, and environmental impact - work in a multidisciplinary team
learningOutcomes.sv: After completing the course, the student can: - rationalize the principles of circular economy and their relevance in the production and processing of raw materials - create new designs for product/process/service that follows the circular economy principles - identify opportunities for value-generation from activities supporting circular economy and develop an entrepreneurial mindset - use models for recycling processes to evaluate their feasibility, efficiency, and environmental impact - work in a multidisciplinary team
learningOutcomes.en: After completing the course, the student can: - rationalize the principles of circular economy and their relevance in the production and processing of raw materials - create new designs for product/process/service that follows the circular economy principles - identify opportunities for value-generation from activities supporting circular economy and develop an entrepreneurial mindset - use models for recycling processes to evaluate their feasibility, efficiency, and environmental impact - work in a multidisciplinary team

content.fi: At this course the student conceptualizes the role of a circular economy model for the production of raw materials. The students will work in multidisciplinary teams and apply an entrepreneurial mindset to solve an industry relevant project by developing a new process, product or system design and construct a business plan around it. The student groups will present their projects in front of a panel of experts.
content.sv: At this course the student conceptualizes the role of a circular economy model for the production of raw materials. The students will work in multidisciplinary teams and apply an entrepreneurial mindset to solve an industry relevant project by developing a new process, product or system design and construct a business plan around it. The student groups will present their projects in front of a panel of experts.
content.en: At this course the student conceptualizes the role of a circular economy model for the production of raw materials. The students will work in multidisciplinary teams and apply an entrepreneurial mindset to solve an industry relevant project by developing a new process, product or system design and construct a business plan around it. The student groups will present their projects in front of a panel of experts.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E6130 Metal Recycling Technologies or CHEM-E6230 Recycling Technologies
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E6130 Metal Recycling Technologies or CHEM-E6230 Recycling Technologies
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E6130 Metal Recycling Technologies or CHEM-E6230 Recycling Technologies

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course, a student will be able to:
- identify the different stakeholders in the circular economy and their particular roles
- evaluate environmental impacts of raw materials production and manufacturing processes
- enhance sustainability in the processes for recycling products and materials
- identify business opportunities of technological solutions supporting the circular economy
learningOutcomes.sv:
After the course, a student will be able to:
- identify the different stakeholders in the circular economy and their particular roles
- evaluate environmental impacts of raw materials production and manufacturing processes
- enhance sustainability in the processes for recycling products and materials
- identify business opportunities of technological solutions supporting the circular economy
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course, a student will be able to:
- identify the different stakeholders in the circular economy and their particular roles
- evaluate environmental impacts of raw materials production and manufacturing processes
- enhance sustainability in the processes for recycling products and materials
- identify business opportunities of technological solutions supporting the circular economy

content.fi:
This course connects the different stakeholders, particularly business and consumers into circular economy development. It also provides a systemic approach and cooperation among actors operating in the supply chain with different themes:
1)    The business landscape
2)    The metal producing and recycling industry
3)    Technologies and methods for enhancing sustainability
Strategy transformation and cultural change

prerequisites.fi: Compulsory prerequisites: The laboratory safety course CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 or CHEM-E0140 must be completed before starting laboratory work.
prerequisites.sv: Compulsory prerequisites: The laboratory safety course CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 or CHEM-E0140 must be completed before starting laboratory work.
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: The laboratory safety course CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 or CHEM-E0140 must be completed before starting laboratory work.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student
*Knows technical solutions for typical mixing problems
*Can solve fluid flow problems based on material, energy and momentum balances
*Can use modern simulation tools to solve fluid flow problems numerically
*Understands how fluid flow affects process performance and can design processes to ensure proper fluid flow
*Understands the nature of  non-Newtonian and multiphase fluid flows
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course the student *Knows technical solutions for typical mixing problems *Can solve fluid flow problems based on material, energy and momentum balances *Can use modern simulation tools to solve fluid flow problems numerically *Understands how fluid flow affects process performance and can design processes to ensure proper fluid flow *Understands the nature of  non-Newtonian and multiphase fluid flows
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student *Knows technical solutions for typical mixing problems *Can solve fluid flow problems based on material, energy and momentum balances *Can use modern simulation tools to solve fluid flow problems numerically *Understands how fluid flow affects process performance and can design processes to ensure proper fluid flow *Understands the nature of  non-Newtonian and multiphase fluid flows

content.fi: Navier-Stokes equations and computational fluid dynamics in single and multiphase systems Fundamentals of mixing: stirred vessels (gassed, slurries), static mixers, mixing in reactors Multiphase flow in pipes and process units, settling, fluidization Fluid flow in porous materials Practical design of unit operations for controlled multiphase flow Non-Newtonian flow, rheological property models Fluid flow measurements
content.sv: Navier-Stokes equations and computational fluid dynamics in single and multiphase systems Fundamentals of mixing: stirred vessels (gassed, slurries), static mixers, mixing in reactors Multiphase flow in pipes and process units, settling, fluidization Fluid flow in porous materials Practical design of unit operations for controlled multiphase flow Non-Newtonian flow, rheological property models Fluid flow measurements
content.en: Navier-Stokes equations and computational fluid dynamics in single and multiphase systems Fundamentals of mixing: stirred vessels (gassed, slurries), static mixers, mixing in reactors Multiphase flow in pipes and process units, settling, fluidization Fluid flow in porous materials Practical design of unit operations for controlled multiphase flow Non-Newtonian flow, rheological property models Fluid flow measurements

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student will
  • understand the fundamental properties of minerals and their relevance in mineral enrichment and recycling operations
  • generate material balances from experimental observations and analyze process performance
  • understand the principles of grinding, liberation and classification,
  • understand the properties of solid particles and slurries and their means of transport
  • understand basic mineral properties and how to exploit them in enrichment operation technologies,
  • understand the effects of liberation on processing and recycling from a product-centric viewpoint

  • understand basic mineral properties and how to exploit them in enrichment operation technologies,
  • understand the effects of liberation on processing and recycling from a product-centric viewpoint

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student
- can describe the basic unit processes and technologies in ferroalloys and steelmaking production,
- can describe the basics of sulphide smelting and the key processing technologies used for non-ferrous metals,
- knows the basics of process modelling,
- is able to calculate mass and energy balances as well as perform simple process simulations for industrial production units using computational methods

content.fi: The course gives an overview of the most important high-temperature metal making processes. The main focus is in the ferroalloys and steelmaking as well as in the non-ferrous metals. Fundamental principles and technologies will be addressed and computational process modelling will be introduced and practiced.

learningOutcomes.fi:
This course aims to address directly one of the main objectives of the EIT-AMIS Master's Programme by preparing graduates to plan and prepare for their professional career in the commercialization, R&D, Innovation, or New Business Development functions of companies, while collaborating closely with industrial partners. The course draws heavily on a learning-by-doing pedagogical approach, which is reflected on how the course is designed and how students are assessed. 
Under completion of the course the student will be able to develop the following knowledge and skills: 
Ability to work on developing a solution-focused approach in translating innovations into feasible business solutions 
Ability to identify immediate consequences of plans and decisions in developing business solutions from technological innovations 
Development of expertise and capabilities in managing resources needed to commercialize new technologies 
Develop knowledge and expertise in research methods, processes and techniques employed in leading companies in the raw materials sector in developing new technologies 
Develop knowledge and expertise in methods and processes employed in leading companies in the raw materials sector in commercializing new technologies and developing new business solution or activities 
Develop knowledge and expertise in developing business models from the commercialization process of new technologies 
Develop knowledge and expertise in understanding the boundary conditions and constrains of the commercialization process within existing companies 
Develop knowledge of the professional role of innovation, R&D, or New Business Development manager involves as a career path option

content.fi:
The course is designed to allow individual students to work for approximately 3 months period at the premises of a company or a research group on an applied research project. The project objectives will be selected in advance between the local parenting company and the local partnering university.
At the end of the course, the students will present or report the outcomes of their project, and submit a thorough reflective essay/report of their internship experience.
